Reviews.Title: “DO NOT RECOMMEND”
Reviews.Author: Toni M
Reviews.Content: I have to say we did read some of the reviews but were willing to give this hotel a chance. I can honestly say we will never be staying here again. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The best part was being on the boardwalk. Toaster did not work, only one burner worked on the stove, the skirting on the bed & the drapes had stains all over them. Area where you can hang your clothes had stains/ mold on wall.. I have to say a total general cleaning of this hotel needs to be done. Just walking into the hotel, stains on the walls.. dirty trim, all it would take is a good cleaning & painting and this hotel would be fine. Very dissapointed. Luckly we did not experience the bed bugs as I have heard now.. but honestly not a good place to stay.. do not waster your money.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location....”
Reviews.Author: vucat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a suite in the Tidelands the past two years – last year over the 4th and this year over Labor Day. On both occasions the goal was a low cost trip with friends and on both occasions the Tidelands delivered. We were interested in reasonably priced accommodations with a pool and a patio off of the room located near the boardwalk. I was dismayed by the poor reviews, but decided to stay there again based on our previous experience. First of all, bed bugs are a serious accusation and I’d hope a reviewer wouldn’t use this term flippantly. I would argue any serious reports of bedbugs would be to the Department of Health and the area would be quarantined, as I’ve seen happen locally. I saw no evidence of such and frankly suspect the references are due to a few vindictive patrons. Our mattress (while certainly not the most comfortable) was in great shape and free of stains, etc. In my opinion, the hotel is priced appropriately for its location, amenities, and level of service. The hotel certainly has its pros and cons and I’ll address a few of them below along with a few takeaways. The hotel has the ideal location with beach views available and right on the boardwalk between Shenanigans and Hooters. The rooms are clean, spacious, and all feature a nice-sized balcony. The sliding door was in great shape with a nice sheer curtain under a black-out curtain (which came in handy as we enjoyed sleeping in). The air conditioning was controlled locally by a thermostat and fantastic. While it was hot and humid outside it was always a cool 70 degrees in our suite. Parking is provided below the hotel and in an overflow lot a few blocks back. They advertise one spot per room, but did offer us a second “overflow only” spot upon request because we booked a suite. The free ice machine is large/industrial and conveniently located on the 3rd floor. The pool bar had decent appetizers and reasonably priced (for the location) drinks. The rooms feature a tiled floor. While this was clean upon our arrival, we carried our share of sand into the room. Maid service seems to be limited to taking out the trash, swapping towels, and making the bed. They don’t seem to clean the floor, etc. except between guests. The maid did have a bad habit of spraying some type of cologne when finished, I would have preferred she pass, but it did dissipate. While the bathroom was clean, the water pressure is lacking. That being said, we never had issues with temperature and the pressure was enough to bathe. Both pools tend to fill with children whose parents don’t seem to supervise them, but this can’t be blamed on the hotel. If I were in charge I’d send the children to the rooftop pool and leave the pool near the bar as “adults only,” but I don’t see this happening. The rooftop pool is a bit frustrating because there is no public bathroom nearby and the buildings aren’t connected.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average”
Reviews.Author: Rich S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose this Hotel because it was on the Boardwalk, had a good pool, and looked ok in the photo's. This hotel was not all bad, however, it was not a great hotel by any means. -The Good - Great location to beach and Boardwalk- You can't beat staying on the Boardwalk in my opinion unless your are looking to keep things very quiet. - The hotel had two pools, one on the roof and one on the 2nd floor. The 2nd floor Pool had a nice Bar and Grill, The Blue Fin - Very friendly service. The Balcony was nice and big and gave us room for our Beach Chairs and their own patio chairs. - The Bad - The Room did have a musty smell to it, especially when the A/C was on. The cleaning service not so great. We had to request new towels even though they took our dirty towels. I was also annoyed because the second night I had spilled drinks all over the and bed we had in our room including the sheets. The sheets were soaked yet the cleaning crew just made the bed and left the wet sheets on the bed. I guess my fault as I should have asked for new sheets but I had figured common sense would prevail. The room was old, and the fridge did Ice over but that was because the people before me had it on MAX. The bed was not all that comfortable. The room did not have enough pillows. Also, on our first night at the hotel, the fire alarm went off at 2:30 AM with no explanation as to why. -My overall opinion is that for the money, the hotel was not the best option, however, I do think that a bunch of 20 something kids would be able to deal with this place without any issue. If your looking for a full resort experience, then staying at another hotel may be your best decision. If you're in town for a few days, don't plan on doing anything in the room other then sleeping, and don't care about the little things, then this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Supermami5
Reviews.Content: Below is an email sent to tidelands that included pictures we have yet to be contacted by anyone. Our stay at the Tidelands Caribbean Hotel was much less than stellar.  We arrived at the property on 8/26/2012 and will depart on 8/30/2012.  We decided on this particular hotel because we're Travel Agents and occasionally we get requests from clients wish to be recommended to a few of the smaller hotels that don't carry a big, well-known name.   Upon arrival we stated that we were Travel Agents which was also stated on our reservation.  On our way to the room we immediately noticed certain things that we felt should have addressed.  As we exited the elevator on the 4th floor there was a terrible smell that greeted us.  It smelled possibly of mold, very musty and it carried throughout the entire 4th floor.  The carpet was well-vacuumed, but it was wet in some places.  This could have been from guests tracking water up from the pool which was located on the 2nd floor, but interestingly, none of the other floors had that smell.  When we entered the suite, we noticed that the lampshades were stained, had what appeared to be mold on them and had what appeared to be strands of human hair on one of them (there were a total of 5 lamps in the suite) we have included pictures. Also, there were no face-plates covering the electrical outlets in the room with the balcony.  The floors in the suite weren't sticky or spotty, but they definitely were grimy!  Walking barefoot on them before our trip to the beach netted an unwanted amount of sand and grit.  Room service was non-existent and expressing our concerns to the front desk was met with silence and long faces.  At one point, one of the ladies at the font desk told an older gentleman who was in training that he can "expect to get a lot of complaints about room cleaning". Of course we expressed our concerns to the front desk and asked to speak to the manager.  We were told he wasn't available.  We left our business cards and asked that he call us in the morning (the morning of day 2).  We received no such call.  This room cleaning issue was a constant so we questioned the front desk for the manager again.  We were immediately told that he wasn't there at the time.  We then questioned the front desk attendants as to the room cleaning policy for the hotel.  We figured maybe the policy was such that one would have to REQUEST their room to be cleaned, otherwise it wouldn't be.  It was at this point the she walked away from us entered the back room for about 15 seconds came right back out with the manager. The manager, Paul Kahn, was calm and attentive.  Interestingly, he denied ever getting our request for him to call us and said he never received our business cards.  He did make a call to housekeeping to inquire about what happened, had someone go clean our room immediately and asked for another business card. However, we met with the same thing again the next day. The bright spot by far was The BlueFin Restaurant/Bar!!  They were amazing.  Very attentive with a smile, drinks and food were great , they were able to recommend certain items on the menu and they even came out to service the guest while out at the pool!  Kudos to them!!   Very dissatisfied and unhappy. A waste of money. Unfortuanatly will not be recommending to our clients and would like some feedback from property owner.

Reviews.Title: “Don't EVER even think about booking a room at The Tidelands!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Patt R
Reviews.Content: After my son had bed bugs in his room over Memorial Day Weekend, I decided not to stay there for Bike Week. Three weeks ago today, I cancelled by reservations. I had put $500 down on my room back in March 2012 and they told me if I cancelled it would cost 10% of one night's stay. When I cancelled on AUGUST 6th, 2012 they told me it would be 10% if my deposit which would be $50.00. Right there I knew I would have trouble getting anything back from these people. To date - they have not sent me a check. They told me that their policy was that a check would be issued within 5 days of cancellation. They promptly cashed my check in March. I have called for my refund numerous times. They tell me a woman comes in until 9 am and she is the only one that can issue checks. They did not know her name. I have left numerous messages for the Manager who has yet to call me back. Now it has been 3 weeks and no check. Now I have to hire an attorney to try and get my deposit back. So people, I'm telling you - besides the fact that they DO HAVE BED BUGS they will also rip you off. They did move my son to some apartment down the street when he caught and brought the Bed Bugs to the front desk. They gave him absolutely no compensation otherwise. DO NOT STAY AT THIS BUG INFESTED crooked hotel. Patti Reilly Gaithersburg, MD

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jaimet49
Reviews.Content: We took a weekend trip to OC this weekend from Friday until Sunday. We originally booked a room at a place that turned out to be a complete dump. Since we got there so late we stayed the night at the dump. Upon waking the next morning we called Tidelands and explained our situation. They were so wonderful and accommodating. They waived the two night minimum for us and gave us a beautiful ocean view room for a very reasonable rate. I had stayed there years ago and loved it and still do. The rooms are clean, bright and airy. The staff is super nice and helpful. The kids decided that OC is the beach we will always go to from now on and Tidelands is the hotel we will always stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Where to begin? How about stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Allan G
Reviews.Content: For a high priced beach front hotel it's reasonable to have high expectations. Immediately you will be underwhelmed by the room and its dated appearance. The beds were uncomfortable and in the 3 days we stayed there the maid never cleaned the room once. I would have to call down to the front desk to get our bathroom supplies restocked after returning to a dirty room. The real kicker was charging for the use of the ice machine ($0.25). It's not the price but principal. With taxes and fees the place averaged a cost of $250 a night and that doesn't include ice? Don't bother reporting it to the robotic staff. When I checked out I was not even asked how my stay was or thanked for my business. I did not see any bed bugs in my room but I did read that other reviewers on tripadvisor recently who experienced that problem. After my stay there and my interactions with the staff, I can't say that would surprise me at all. Stay away from this place! I don't consider myself someone with high standards when it comes to hotels but I think a clean room, clean towels, and friendly staff would fall into everyone's standards for a $200+ per night hotel. The Tidelands Caribbean fails in every one of these respects.

Reviews.Title: “It's not the worst place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: JenniferGrabowski
Reviews.Content: Arrived on 8-17-12. Stayed in ocean front room on boardwalk, 3rd floor. Front desk lady was ok. I mean, I didn't want to be her best friend so I really didn't start a conversation with her. Room was fine for boardwalk location. I checked for bed bugs, didn't see anything. I do have bites BUT I went putt putt golfing at Malibus mini golf I found several Mosquitos on me! Bathtub was moldy under the caulk and in some grout lines but I didn't go licking it so I wasn't too worried. The housekeeping ladies were very nice. Always said hello asked how our day was, etc. We really didn't make a huge mess so other then grabbing towels from them we didn't need their services but twice and they did a good job! The pool near the bar and the bar sucked. Too many kids for such a small area. The bartender Keith or Kevin was an arrogant SOB. The pool bar bathrooms were HORRIBLE. As in I would have rather peed in the pool HORRIBLE. The pool on the roof....fabulous and clean and quiet for the most part. Great views too! Hooters...was not a problem. I have no idea what people were complaining about? It was quiet and they closed rather early in my opinion. Parking....was not a problem. I paid for a room on the boardwalk for a reason! Took bikes and the car never moved for 8 days! Elevator...only one but I used it twice. To take luggage to room and a week later to bring in down, otherwise we used the steps! Please understand my husband and I have no children and have been coming to OC for 52 and 37 years! This is by far not the worst place. However, should you have children with you I can see where the cleanliness of the rooms might be an issue! I know better than to sit on the floor and lick the tub. I wouldn't cancel reservations, just use common sense when you arrive! Check the room out before bringing your stuff in. If the hotel would pay for some upgrades I think it would be well worth the 300 a night. However, it is ocean city Maryland NOT the Hilton on the Virgin Islands!

Reviews.Title: “DISGUISTING!”
Reviews.Author: kenbon1331
Reviews.Content: First off, we werent able to get into our room until 30 minutes after check in time. When we get in the room, the a/c had never been turned on, must have been close to 100 degrees, which tells me the room had been ready for hours. Once in the room we found no hotel information ( ice machine location, pool location, stuff like that). Light bulbs missing, black mold on the bottom of the drapes and in the bathroom floor grout. No extra pillows, had no idea what channel the t.v. was on........ Granted, the was the old part of the building, but SHOULD be much cleaner. The room was beachfront so we had a great view to look at every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Lost Faith, but then Got it Back 8/21-8/22/12”
Reviews.Author: Travis_2500
Reviews.Content: This is a 2 part review...Night 1, I took my girlfriend to Ocean City for the first time...we got a Ocean Block Room for $250...the room was hot, the cleanings had black mold, there was a mini fridge that was froze solid, the microwave didnt work, and the hallway to outside was soaked..the ac had been leaking and was causing an awful smell...I was disapointed in the room BIG TIME! I normally stay here for St. Pattys day in an Ocean Front room The Lady at check in was very nice and gave us our parking pass early.....the hotel Bar & Grill was really good and the bartender/ waitress was really cool We decided to stay a second day and the neighboring hotels where full...so we had no choice to on the boardwalk at a reasonable price (Under $150) Day 2...We got the cheapest hotel room they had $99 + tax....it was GREAT! 2 queen size beds, large bathroom, full kitchen area with mini fridge, working, sink, stove topm, microwave, coffee pot with coffee and even silver ware and clean glasses! It was a complete 180 over the $250 room! The lady working the lobby the second day was not the nicest person to deal with...I made a reservation the day of at 11am and she acted like I was troubling her...the room was to be ready @ 3pm but we where not in a hurry since we made a late decision...I checked back at 3:30pm ans she said it wasnt ready so we went back to the beach...at 5pm two younger ladies where working...we asked them and they said the room had been ready since 2:30....oh well, nothing major but still I had lost faith in this place on day 1, but day 2 was a complete turn around...when we go back and if we stay here, I will go for the cheapest room again BTW we didnt know that the weekend before hand was part of the Mt. Dew Ocean Championships which caused a lot of places to be full

Reviews.Title: “On the cusp of greatness, but falling short”
Reviews.Author: Mass_bitte
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been staying here exclusively for five years now, sometimes twice a summer. I want to love the place, and it has its strong points, but it needs some serious care. Our last stay was over Memorial Day. I've looked at a few recent reviews/photos and I'm glad we booked elsewhere for Labor Day weekend. The change was really by chance, no oceanfront rooms were available, so we booked at the Paradise Plaza Hotel. I'll be interested to compare the two since Tidelands has been our mainstay for so long. It seems that things here have taken a sharp turn of the worse, when before the decline was slow, but noticeable. We always stayed in oceanfront rooms and they've been clean enough. There have been times when the paint left something to be desired, and some water stains on the ceiling, a few other nits, but nothing deal breaking. When we first starting coming, cleanliness was a major draw. That must have been soon after their last update as the place has slowly deteriorated since then. The sad part is that it seems that management is in no real hurry to give the place any real attention. But again, we always rented here for the location and the lovely beachfront view, and we've never experienced anything gross or buggy. While I look forward to trying out Paradise Plaza, the view here, with the proximity to the kite shop's beach display, just can't be beat. Plus you have a Dunkin Donuts directly below the hotel for a morning coffee. The place really has potential, but it's falling well short of it. Other pluses, check-in is always easy and friendly. If you arrive early and your room is ready they'll check you in. If not, they'll give you a call on your cell when it is. The pool bar is a nice extra. While we rarely use it, over our last visit friends of ours with children stayed at the hotel so we spent some time sipping beverages while the kids enjoyed the pool. There is another pool (sans-bar) on the roof if you feel inclined. A few additional thoughts; we've never had an issue with parking. The elevator is extremely slow so locate the nearest stairwell. And finally, we've always desired a loyalty program here, and despite recommending it on many occasions, they've never instituted one. In regard to the apparent bed bug issue, that's just a shame. A little dust in the corner never bothers me, some rust on the balcony, fine, but bed bugs are just unacceptable; especially if they continue to rent with knowledge of their presence. While it's probably not the hotels fault for getting them, it should be their top priority to eradicate them. Given this new information, the place probably deserves one star, but we didn’t experience this over our last stay. Maybe I'm being nostalgic, but minus the feeling that the place was not being cared for as it should, our room over Memorial Day was what we’ve come to expect. If the management happens to read this review, to them I say, "Viva la renovation!"

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your hard-earned money on this dump!”
Reviews.Author: BreezeOtheSea
Reviews.Content: The customer service at Tidelands was the worst I have ever experienced at a hotel. The front desk staff, including the manager, was very rude and unaccomodating. When finally confronted about the poor customer service, the night manager was very unapologetic and appeared annoyed to even have to deal with customers! Very frustrating as a paying customer, especially when the nightly rates to stay at this dump were close to $300/night! What a waste. The room was dirty, the bathtub would not drain and the housekeeping never left clean towels (we had to call every day and request them!!!). The pillows and sheets on the bed were deflated and worn. Yuk! The uncleanliness of this hotel would explain why they now have a bed bug infestation. This would also explain why there was a pest control truck there the day of our arrival!!!! We were also awoken several times during the night due to loud and unruly guests. No good all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs, dirty and poor service”
Reviews.Author: Michele H
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Tidelands 8/16-8/20 but our experience started before we arrived. I had booked this on line and called the location to ask about the king suite which was listed at $247 on the official ocean city website. I had originally booked the queen room at $209 but the king was available so I called to inquire. The person I spoke to told me about the king suite so she told me that instead of me going through the internet she would give me the same rate because she just had to print them in and put them on the computer at the location. So I booked, but two days before leaving my husband looked at the email and it was $1028.50 which was not the price agreed upon an was charged $289 1 night and $309 for the other two nights. So my husband looked up the reviews and we were upset with the reviews of bed bugs, mold, poor service and so on. So I called the hotel and spend 15 minutes talking to a representative of the company that told me that the employee that took my reservation no longer worked for the company. I was told there was nothing that could be done about this so I asked to speak to the manager Paul Kahn who I left a message for and never returned my call. So,,we were stuck-no refund and no place to stay so we checked in and it was worse than expected. The folllowing is a list of the issues that we had 1. bedspreads and sheets were dirty and had hair on them, they also had holes in them from burns-the sheets were paper thin and did not fit the mattress-the box springs had a zip protector on it so I should have realized that the bed bug issue was real 2. pillows were filthy and flat 3. the floor was dirty along with the baseboard, walls, furniture, kitchen 4. paint splatters on the floor 5. refridgerator did not work 6. both remotes did not work and the backs were taped together 7. the pull out bed was broken 8. the bathtub had mold around it 9. The dresser drawers were dirty 10. Microwave was small and had no turn table 11. No disposable cups in bathroom 12. Water pressure was a trickle 13. The mattress' were flat and lumpy 14. Lamp shades were dirty and one was defective 15. Kitchen was not as claimed-small microve, a hood that didn't work, small fridge, 2 burner top and did not work, The housekeeping was terrible, I had put the towels on the floor in the bathroom every day to have them laundered. On Saturday we came back to the room in the afternoon and it appeared that housekeeping had been there due to the beds being made and what appeared to be clean towels on the shelf in the bathroom. Then housekeeping knocked on the door and brought new towels and took the towels out that were on the shelf, so I am assuming they just folded the towels and put them back on the shelf. The sinks, tubs and toilets were never cleaned and the toilet paper was not replaced. The entire location was filthy. The housekeeping drug clean towels around in black garbage bags to deliver them. The restrooms at the restaurant was filthy. Then to come home with bed bugs!!! My husband called around 7:30 pm to discuss this matter with the manager which again was unavailable. I am going to post an update as I am contacted or not contacted.

Reviews.Title: “Gross!”
Reviews.Author: VanityFair2012
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? It STINKS Soo bad it's rediculous. I walk in there and almost threw up but since we were on a budget it was are only choice. The beds were big and nice but they smelled weird. So did the bathroom. The room didnt have enough light in it. So did the bathroom. So overall it was a 2 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, ants in the room...there is better lodging out there”
Reviews.Author: kimmiebrite
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is my personal experience, but as recent reviews show, the negative opinions are shared by more than a few people. It was a waste of hundreds of dollars. I called the Worcester County Health Department today. People--it's this bad. Please contact them too (I'd be happy to share info on how to reach them). This is the health department that will handle bed bug reports specifically (I see lots of folks mentioned it). I'm also writing to the hotel today. We'll never stay here again & tell others to avoid it. The bad first, then the good... THE BAD: Looks great from the outside. The two pools are deceptively small & not deep--I wouldn't go near them. Noisy. You can hear the banging doors, running feet, street noise, etc. Signs of bed bugs, but we didn't get bitten. NASTY. Do they even clean?? We check in, get our keys & none of them worked. I go downstairs to complain, they swipe them, I go upstairs--they keys don't work. This time I call them up & they get there and "reprogram" the lock. A few hours later, we return from an outing & none of the keys work. [Repeat this story 4 times here]... By the end of our 3 day stay, we had a total of 12 keys! None of which worked for more than 2 hours at a time. Disgraceful to be told by staff that "it works now" repeatedly. They don't care. Ants were crawling all over the floor around the tiny fridge--I mean smaller than dorm size fridge tiny. From under the fridge to the window. GROSS. I didn't even want to put my shoes on the floor! Eventually the ants made their way around the entire room. HORRIFIC. The hallways are carpeted. Well then Tidelands, you need to vacuum. How are giant hairballs, sand, dirt, kids' toys, debris of all sorts piled up in FRONT of our door in the hallway??? And yes, this dirty state remained that way for our 3 day stay, never heard a vacuum run up the hallway. DISGUSTING. I wondered why, if they knew how many guests would be there they didn't supply the same number of towels? I had to call the front desk & ask for extra towels of all kinds to be brought upstairs. THE GOOD: Parking is a pain, but the hotel has more than one location to park that is within walking distance. Our 2 room suite was generously sized, not too dated, facing the bayside/city view on the 4th floor. It's near a ton of good stuff that makes the stay doable.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tracey G
Reviews.Content: OMG!!!! Where do I start? Just returned home from a 4 day stay at the tidelands!!! Think my family and I should call CDC on this place.. We were on the 3rd floor facing hooters which kept us entertained all night between fighting and arrests etc.. Our first night was ok didn't care for the bathroom considering I spent an hour scrubbing it cuz it was GROSS! Housekeeping comes at 9 and if u asked them to come back they tell u they can't. Second night I pulled out the sofa bed for my daughter and niece and WOW!!!! BED BUGSSSSSS!!!!!! I inspected the whole room and noticed our two beds had brand new mattresses and protective covering which suggested to me that they had a problem prior to August 2012! Went down to the front desk to complain and they were not surprised but didn't care either! We spent the next 3 nights sleeping 3 in a bed. Which because of the protective covering none of us were bitten..every morning we would put our dirty towels in hallway and call up for more and would grab our own toilet paper off the cart. Room was dirty, mold in shower, bathroom smelled like urine ,and went out to get my own Clorox wipes and air freshened and Lysol. To end the vacation my niece and daughter came home I'll with high fevers and aches and pains!!!! I should have went with my instincts and listened to the reviews.. I think the good reviews which are very few ; I think they are written by made up people close to this establishment!!!! Save your money and listen to reviews ... We as AMERICANS work to hard to have our money wasted like that. Hated going back to the room at night. I would rather cut off my eye lids and stare at the sun!!!!!! T.L.G. Pocono, Pa.

Reviews.Title: “My dog had it better in the kennel!!!”
Reviews.Content: Staff was unhelpful. Had to ask for TP, tissues, cups, etc. Bed was sandy before it was ever used and very lumpy. Way OVERPRICED for what we got. And if you want to use luggage carts to make moving in or out easier- forget it. Staff says they have them, but good luck finding one. Location was a winner. Pool was nice. Everything else was questionable.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lally66
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be shut down. It was dirty ....moldy..in disarray..and management could care less. Realized in moments of entering room that we did not want to stay..unfortunately after hours of trying to get out of reservation....we had no option but to stay...as they would not refund a single dime. Wish we had read the reviews first instead of now....dozens of. Bed bug bites later....what a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kristin M
Reviews.Content: I booked an Oceanfront room in February! My husband and daughter picked the hotel (he had stayed there before) then I started reading the reviews and boy was I scared, I even thought of canceling my reservation and rebooking somewhere else. I am glad that I did not! Our stay was most pleasant. We arrived around 3 on July 30th our room was not ready, so we went to the boardwalk and grabbed a sandwich, about half way to Bull on the Beach we received a phone call our room was ready. Upon arriving we noticed that we would need more towels, we received five additional towels in minutes. I forgot to mention that three weeks before we left I was reading reviews and they stated that there was a smoking floor at which time I called and requested that my family not be on that floor, and we were exactly where we wanted to be on the 4th floor. Everyday our room was cleaned and towels were left (extra ones every day). The staff was pleasant and spoke to us everytime we saw one of them. Our room keys were not the best, but we managed! My mother-in-law and daughter went parasailing our last full day there and they did not have a key to get into the apt after ... they were given a 3rd key with no questions asked!!! Ignore the reviews !! I am glad that I chose to stay here. I will also mention that we visited the 5th floor pool everyday (never made it to the barside pool) .... but we loved the other one.. other than your normal sand from everyone coming up from the beach it was very clean !!!

Reviews.Title: “Never will come back to nor recommend to anybody!”
Reviews.Author: Toyen P
Reviews.Content: Pro: good location, nice hotel Cons: • Hidden Fee: $8.75/night for hospital fee • Freezer: Too small • Condition of Room: Sand covered floor • Fire Alarm: Uncontrollable On the last day that we were at the hotel, the fire alarm went off while I was cooking breakfast for my family. It was about 7am. The night shift receptionist called us twice to ask us about the fire alarm. We did as she told us by opening the door to the hallway, opening the door to the balcony, and by fanning the fire alarm. After a while, the smoke was gone, but the fire alarm was still on. It was extremely loud and our ears were hurt. We grabbed our belongings as quickly as possible so that we could get out of the hotel as soon as possible. The receptionist came to our room but she couldn’t do anything. Before she left, she told us that she was going to call somebody to fix it. I don’t know if she ever called anybody but when I checked out at 8:30am, she was gone for the day. I complained about the noisy fire alarm to the day shift staff, so they sent somebody to our room to take a look. Except that was when we left, never to come back there again. The sad thing was that it was my birthday, and I was very upset. My day was ruined by the uncontrollable fire alarm, and the receptionist that didn’t care enough about the hotel’s customers.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was fine...”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer W
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Tidelands at the end of July. We booked and then read the reviews...what we read really scared us. We went with the idea that if things were bad, we would do what we had to in order to make it right, and if we found bedbugs, we would not be staying... All this worrying for nothing. This hotel is not the Hilton...furnishings were older and mattress in king size beds did cave in a little, but largely, our stay was pleasant. We had no trouble with parking, the proximity to the beach and boardwalk is fantastic, and our housekeepers were pleasant and responsive. We always had what we needed, and when we asked for sheets for the pull out sofa, we recieved them within 5 minutes. The pool and pool bar were a great way for the family to relax. Again, the furnishings are not new, and the water pressure is not phenomenal, however, we had a good experience overall...if you expect the Hilton...go to the Hilton. If you are just looking for a place to sleep while enjoying all the beach and boardwalk have to offer, this worked out just fine...

Reviews.Title: “gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: yogibear1962
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in our recent stay here. This hotel has so much potential, but they really miss the mark. The best thing about this hotel is the location. Everything else is so wrong. The service is terrible. Our safe, which they charge extra for, did not work. It took two hours to get someone to come replace it. Several lights did not work. The room was dirty. The bathroom was dark and dingy. There is no fan in the bathroom and the water pressure was so bad you could tell the shampoo did not rince out. We were never given enough towels for the four of us. Always had to request more. They do not change the sheets, just make the bed. The sliding glass doors barely work. And don't even get me started on how bad the mattresses are. OMG..king size beds are nice, but not when they are so so so uncomfortable. The pillows were bad and the sheets were cheap..and no matress cover. When we checked out, the girl didn't even look at us much less ask us how our stay was. We will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Last stay after nearly 10 years of patronage”
Reviews.Author: fink369
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at the Tidelands Caribbean since Memorial day 2003. At that time I would have given it a Very Good, even Excellent when compared to other OC hotels which have a reputation for being a little trashy. We loved the 2 room King suites, which at the time were very new, the tile floors, the location on the boardwalk and the space in each room. It was great! WAS being the operative word. This past visit would have made our 6th visit and the change over the years has not been welcome. Let's start with our arrival. It began much like all the others, we arrive mid-morning. We go to the check-in desk, the room isn't ready (of course, we wouldn't expect it to be at 10:30 since check in isn't really until 3pm) but we pay our balance and they provide us a parking pass. Also, as they have done in past visits, they take my cell phone number and promise to call when it is ready. I see her write my number down, next to our future room number 221. Normally, we would have stayed on the beach until we were called but this particular visit an afternoon thunderstorm had us taking cover around 2:30. I thought as long as we had packed it up I may as well check on the room status. Still before official check in time though I wasn't suprised that it wasn't ready but the person at the front desk said it shouldn't be much longer and double checked that they had my phone number. My son and his friend went to the pool while my husband and I hung in the car--no sense in going to far since it would be ready soon right? It was nearly 4pm when I walked back into the lobby to see if they had forgotten to call me, an hour after check in time. "I'm sorry , you're room isn't ready yet but I just spoke to housekeeping and they were doing your floors. It should only be another 10 minutes". At this point I decide to head to the pool bar and drown my annoyance. On the way to the bar and walked by our room which happened to be on the same floor. What I gathered from dawdling out in the hallway was that housekeeping was just starting the room. I went to the bar and at 5pm still hadn't received a phone call. Housekeeping was no longer in the hallway so I headed downstairs to the desk where I found a totally different set of receptionists. I doubt I ever would have received a call and yes, the room was ready and delivered to me 2 hours late. Really, the 5pm wouldn't even be a big deal except that I misled twice. Be honest with me, don't lie to get me out of your face. I could have better spent the time hanging on the boardwalk. Oh and while visiting the pool bar I noticed that the soap in the bathroom was empty, twice. So where are their employees washing their hands exactly? We had a 2 room King suite again. This was the 4th time with this room type. The other two times were in the Ocean view 1King room. Each visit I noticed things that needed sprucing. This time there were things in serious disrepair. I started with my usual bedbug check. This is something I do in EVERY hotel, 5 star or 1 star, bedbugs don't discriminate. However I was far more thorough this time after a very recent reviewer was bitten by and had managment confirm they had bedbugs. I actually took the time to contact this reviewer and she stated that the managments response was to give them black oversized trashbags to put their belongings in and told them not to take them in their house. So instead of giving a quick check of the corners of the mattess and box springs I stripped both of the beds completely. I did not find any evidence of bedbugs (but that doesn't mean you shouldn't check or that they weren't there). One of the mattesses was in absolutely terrible repair. The tape that locks the seams of the mattess had completely come undone and you could see into the springs of the mattress. In general I'd say they were old or of very very poor quality as neither my husband slept well. The teenagers were OK but then they could sleep upside down on a rock. The sheets were worn and frayed in places and one sheet was yellowed it was so old. Not that it was easy to see in the second windowless room where there was only one pitiful floor lamp. I had to do that inspection by the light on my camera phone. Other notable issues: the safe seemed to be malfunctioning, the toilet was not properly leveled and rocked every time I sat down (and then ran so the rocking may have been causing leaking as well), there was no tv remote in the main bedroom and the second bedroom had a remote but it wasn't functional. Oh and the floor that they had been cleaning when I was denied check in, wasn't really all that clean. There was still lots of sand particularly in the corners. The bathroom shower stall was dirty looking on the floor and the prior guest had left their scrubby hanging in the shower which housekeeping also missed. Makes me wonder if they did anything more than restock the towels and toiletries which there were enough of. And yes, if you thinking I'm being overly picky, I probably am but since it was their reason to deny our checkin for two hours then I'm feeling rather justified. I will say the paint looked fresher than it had been the last time we were there two years ago. The rest of our stay involved little interaction with the staff. We had them "clean" the room after our second night. They did replace dirty towels but I have my doubts as to whether the bedsheets were replaced after I found what looked like the same yellow top sheet on our bed. Check out the same person who happily took my money and then lied about the amount of time the room would be ready in took my keys. Didn't bother to ask about my stay. Of course maybe she didn't care. Who knows? One thing I did notice as we were loading the car up, two women standing in the lobby with their belongings in oversized black plastic trash bags. None of us experienced any bites but our belongings are in my hot car, in a trash bag, hopefully frying any covert hitchhikers. This hotel either needs to take better care of their facilites and their guests or lower their price point. The location is the only thing it has going for it anymore and even that isn't worth the rest of the experience.

Reviews.Title: “If you have a reservation, CANCEL”
Reviews.Author: wicked62
Reviews.Content: Best advise, if you have a reservation, take advantage of your cancellation policy. This was the 5th year we stayed at the Tidelands, and it is our last. Hotel should be torn down, nothing works, including the staff and management. We stayed in the two room suits, practically nothing in the room worked, including, the sliding glass doors,(however they did leak during the rain storm) the lights, the safe, the bathroom door. Water pressure so bad you couldn't even get the shampoo out of your hair. The dirtiest room I ever stayed in.!! Everything was covered in dirt, the walls and lamp shades had stains on them that had been there for months. No towels, no toilet paper, no soap, they had a coffee maker in the room that I wouldn't let my dog drink from. Two king size (Badddd beds) with three of the smallest pillows I ever saw. The sheets are so gray you would think they suppose to b that color . The so called cleaning staff came in daily and did nothing but placed some towels in the bathroom, BUT NO TOILET PAPER,the tub and toilet seat looked like someone had taken a hammer to them. Reported the problem of the safe not working, three hours later, someone came to the door, worked on it for 1 hr and said he could not fix it and left, never returned. There was so much dirt around floor of the bed frames and bathroom fixtures you could tell they were not cleaned in a year. NO MANAGEMENT EVER AVAILABLE TO RETURN A CALL ON YOUR ISSUES. IT IS CLEAR THEY ONLY WANT TO CHARGE YOUR CARD AND THEN IGNORE THEIR GUESTS. STAY FAR, FAR AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sara C
Reviews.Content: After staying at the resort for only 3 nights i have a long list of things wrong. During check in i was told first that i did not have a reservation then that we were already checked in and have room keys and parking pass when in reality we had just gotten there. So i had to fight to get my room keys and my parking pass. Then when parking they do not have enough parking within the lot at the hotel for us to park so we were told to go across the street and wed be fine. Ended up getting a parking ticket and was told that its not their problem. Then when walking into the room the floor was so sticky i couldnt walk with my shoes on because they had almost broken, our safe was already locked and we couldnt use it, there were ants in the bathroom, and there was a fake nail in the side table in the bedroom. The Air conditioner was not allowed to be under 70 because it would freeze, the wifi was very difficult to hook up to the pools were very tiny and the pool bar was very expensive at over $8 a drink. The housekeeping staff knocked on the door at 930 in the morning and woke us all up. After not answering after the first knock she continued to knock until someone answered. We had a towel stolen off the balcony, the ice cube maker would not work properly and the walls had something dried on them. Finally the most important thing of was was that the staff could not be bothered. We had 6 people so we needed to use the pull out couch, when we went to ask for sheets and pillows we were first told they didnt have any and then we had them thrown at us. When going down to the front desk after 11 we had to call for assistance, whenever we called we were screamed at on the phone and told they'd be in whenever theyre done. We had to ask more than once every time we needed more towels or blankets. Then after getting a ticket for parking we went to the front desk to talk with the manager and he dipped and dodged us over 6 times and never got back to us. Worst experience i have ever had in a hotel and i will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “DUMP!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chris1gina
Reviews.Content: What a s&$thole of a place! Staff is rude, always on the phone, never want to deal with you. I had to park 3 blocks away in their overflow lot at 8pm and carry my kid across a major roadway. Rooms suck! I wish I could show you pictures! Mold, bathroom piglet didn't work and, after the maid cleaned our room, no toilet paper! You can't make this crap up! I swear, it's a DUMP! Stay away!! Lower pool is open to the public because it has a bar, try getting a seat at your hotel pool!! We had to leave the pool area, or, go to the other buildings roof pool. Please, save your time, money, and patience. Do not stay here. I almost want to leave my email here so I can fully explain how bad this place was!

Reviews.Title: “Nasty”
Reviews.Author: Joyawwad
Reviews.Content: Bad service mold in rooms nothing works smells so bad sand all over floors elevaters don't work dirty beds dusty stains on bedspread and couch and lots of bugs

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!”
Reviews.Author: Chris F
Reviews.Content: We’ve stayed at a handful of hotels in our 20 years of going to OC, but this represents the first one where one stay was one too many! We rented two Oceanview rooms for our family the week of July 15th. To start things off, the clerk didn’t direct us to our room after checking in. Since they have two buildings, we wound up on the “wrong” second floor with two fully loaded carts. The rest of the wonderful “features” we discovered are listed below: -broken safe in one of the rooms -no washcloths in either room. Called front desk but didn’t get them until 6 hours later -missing bed sheet on one of the beds -no hook on bathroom door (but two holes where it used to be) -no towel rack in one of the showers -no disposable cups or soap dishes -water pressure low and not very hot. Disturbing moaning from the pipes when showering. -missing or broken sections of handrail in stairwells. (Took these since elevator is a joke) -parking was horrible. With two rooms you’d think we’d get at least one spot at the hotel. We had to park in their overflow lot over a block away (btw, they still showed vacancies on the marquee!) -constant smell of marijuana on our non smoking floor. We eventually saw local police roaming our floor checking it out. -Hotel pool w/ bar&grille turned into frat party after 8:00pm We chatted with another couple on the elevator. They had stayed there before but said it had really gone downhill and they would not be staying again. The level of concern by the manager was laughable. While he said he would look into these issues, he offered zero compensation for these inconveniences. Only positives were friendly staff and location along the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Heck No!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LHealthpro
Reviews.Content: I am only giving a one star because I can not give 0. We just stayed there over the 4th of July weekend. My kids are traumatized by the elevators. It would jolt and then make an awful noise. Our room was fly infested. We kept calling the front desk for assistance. We would kill one then five would come out of the vents. I called six times to speak to the GM paul. I left messages and he never returned my calls. If that wasn't enough housekeeping knocked on our door with a previous patron stating that she left her android in our room. He asked if she could look around our belongings to see if it was still there. The room was vacant for hours prior to our arrival. This matter could have been handled without involving us. starting with the housekeeper that cleaned the room. SOOOO unprofessional. Only stay here if you want your vacation to SUCK!!!! Lesson Learned!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ckatz_15116
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Tidelands - 6thru15th. I was very disappointed. We had stayed here many years ago and it was wonderful. For what I paid I expected so much more. Room was dirty. Beds were sunken in. Pillows, sheets and bed spreads were stayed and smelled of B.O. The maid was rude and never took our garbage unless I asked her too. I could not believe the attitude se would give when I asked her to sweep the tile floor because of the sand that gets tracked in the room or when I asked for another roll of TP. We never had wash rags or dish towels - she would say everyday she was out of them. Strange, we were the first room of the day for her. I know this because at 7am everyday she would beat on my door yelling house keeping. I read other reviews before we went and decided I would judge it for myself. I should have listened to the other reviewers - they were not lying. This place was horrible. Did I mention the burners on the stove did not work, fridge was warm, tv's had terrible reception- picture was dark and most channels did not come in. Which was not fun when it was raining and you have kids with you. Elevators were slow and smelled. Restaurant was expensive and not that great... The list goes on and on... For being in a non smoking room it smelled of cigarettes all the time because everyone around us were smoking on their balconies. I am so disappointed in the Tidelands. Will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've ever stayed in!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Terry B
Reviews.Content: The only reason this hotel gets a single star is that the review will not accept a zero star rating. Our family rented 4 rooms for 3 days, June 30th till July 3rd. This is the worst hotel I have stayed in in my life. We had problems getting into our rooms which had been reserved 4 months earlier. After getting our rooms we found mold surrounding the bathtubs, huge holes in the towels and washclothes, drywall was falling off the walls, the floors were covered in sand, and very poor service. I will never be staying in this place again and would highly reccommend that you avoid this hotel. We spoke with the manager at the facility and have been awaiting a return phone call for nearly three weeks. I am attaching photos.

Reviews.Title: “What a bummer!”
Reviews.Author: popovsky
Reviews.Content: Here for a few days on the boardwalk with my three kids. Rented a suite for some space but primarily for the kitchenette. 2 king beds with very worn and substandard linens. Almost felt dirty. No blankets. Fridge was inoperative. When I asked about a replacement fridge the desk attendants response was, "were full so there is no room from which to take one from". I had to put everything back in the cooler and ice it down overnight. Place is substandard. Not worth the price. Not worth any price.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!! Stay away!!”
Reviews.Author: Laura S
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. Our ocean front room was large but run down. The sink in the bathroom was falling off the wall. The vent fan did not work and only 2 lightbulbs worked on an old, rusty light fixture. The sliding glass door took two people to open. There were holes in the walls and wires hanging from where smoke detectors should have been. Blinds had layers of dust and the bedspreads had burn holes(in a non-smoking room). The elevator was extremely slow and dirty. The hallways had no a/c and carpet was filthy. It took 3 days for someone to fix the safe in our room. No one ever came to address the other issues dispite multiple phone calls and visits to the front desk. We just got excuses about how busy they were and that there were other more important issues they needed to deal with.Simply put, they were rude. Also, pool/bar was open to the public. It was not a relaxing atmosphere. Wanted to leave and stay anywhere else but could not afford to lose that much money. We were not happy, could not wait to leave and will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “It was the worst experience ever at OC!”
Reviews.Author: SPFamily4
Reviews.Content: We go to OC every other year. We have young teenagers now and were looking for more space but yet still together. Sounded perfect - but sounding and is are 2 different things. First, the couch had stains on it (hoping from suntan lotion) - I put a blanket from my car on it! It was gross! Went for some ice - well, 5th floor broken, 4th floor broken - asked front desk - said 3rd floor is working. But guess what - it's a vending machine for ice - needed quarters. But at the pool bar, you could get a bag of ice for $1. Think the front desk could have told me that! Still they advertice ice machines. And they advertise free internet -- NOT TRUE -- it's in your "hospitality" cost of $9 per day for internet (which didn't always work). Beds were awful and the housekeeping was really bad. They took our dirty towels and didn't give us any new ones. When we asked the front desk for new towels, they sent up housekeeping who didn't knock and came right in! Good thing we were all decent but really! The pool bar was open to the public and was standing room only in the pool. My kids hated it! The roof top pool - sounds good but on a windy day - cold and had to watch your things from blowing away! Other than the location this has nothing going for it. The front desk people were rude and only time they talked to us - was when they thought we were a family who hadn't checked out on time... When I called them to help with directions to the fishing center, they had to call me back... ever where I turned it was awful! If I could have checked out and gone somewhere else I would have but it was too much money to burn away. I will never go there again and will tell all I know that it's not worth it... Only thing we had going was "great weather" which the TIdelands weren't in control off. Good thing or that would have been horrible as well!

Reviews.Title: “Start with Appropriate Expectations”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoadAgain091976
Reviews.Content: This is neither a Hilton nor a Marriott; not a Sheraton or even a Holiday Inn. If you start with appropriate expectations for this property - then you should leave at least satisfied for the money that you spent. There is lots of talk about this hotel's location and that it "can't be beat" - well, that's sadly not the case - because there are at least 20 other hotels that line the Boardwalk in Ocean City - each with the same boardwalk location, ocean front views, and easy beach access. Cleanliness: The room was as clean as an ocean front hotel can be expected to be - there were no noticeable cleaning problems in the room - although the cleaning products that they used did leave the tile floors slightly "sticky." Public areas (hallways, elevators, grounds) were a different story - they were noticeably dusty, dirty and in need of a little attention. Conditions: No matter how "clean" a room is - some things are just "worn" - the furniture was slightly dinged, the metal door jam was rusted at the base in the bathroom, the AC unit was noisier than necessary, all things that happen in a hotel. None of them deal breakers, and none of them things that can be "fixed" immediately upon arrival - or worth complaining about at the hotel... it's who they are. Service: Here is where they fail... and could be so easily remedied... their staff (for the most part) just doesn't care. There are no smiles, there are no good-mornings or good evenings as you walk through the lobby. Your check-in is another thing on the "to-do" list for the day and check-out is about the same. The staff seems much more engaged in talking with each other, that with talking care of their guests. This attitude is evident from the manager down - who was more interested in ridiculing her employees, and a technical computer question than about guests in the lobby during check-out. So - why did I rate this as "poor" - because in shopping around - I could have stayed at the Holiday Inn, or the Courtyard for the same price - or at the Hilton for about $50/more per night. - all of these places with mandatory service standards, and renovation programs. Travel to OCMD again - absolutely. Stay at Tidelands Caribbean again? - Possible, but will certainly do some more comparison price shopping before hand.

Reviews.Title: “To much money for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: gol7750
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here last year. We moved rooms twice because they had a bad odor and were dirty. Never will stay again for this price. When we would see the cleaning staff, they always had beer in their cart and we actually seen them drinking. Yikes! I felt like I couldn't leave anything laying around. We stayed in an oceanfront room. Although the hotel was nice and really liked the tile floors in the rooms, it was not clean and would never pay that price again for this hotel. The only good thing about the hotel was that it was on the boardwalk and the outside bar and pool area. Believe the reviews about this hotel! It is sad too, because if the management would care more and check rooms randomly to ensure very clean rooms this hotel could be one of the best on the boardwalk for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness and housekeeping were something to be desired...”
Reviews.Author: Rebelslady
Reviews.Content: Just got back from OC, first time there is years for me, first time for my kids. We arrived and hour early and were delighted to find that our room was ready, that is where the delight ended. Parking was terrible!!! We stayed in a suite and it was hard to tell were to check-in since there are 2 front desks, one for the suites and one for the main hotel. Location was good on the boardwalk I have to give them that much. Our room keys malfunctioned not once or twice but 5 times in 4 nights!!!! Really annoying to have to continue to go to the front desk for new ones and not even an apology from the front desk!!! Had a kitchenette which had some plates, silverware and what not...that was nice, at least I thought until I grabbed a plate that was dirty, then an other, then another....everything in the cupboard was greasy and dirty like they were used by the last guests. I have no problem cleaning then myself while I am there, but I do expect them to be cleaned between guests!! We were on the third floor and I tried to use the stairwell....could not open the door on the second floor and when I got to the first floor I found to mattresses blocking the hall...this is also the fire exit!!!! How safe is that??? The stairwell also smelled like someone had been using it as a bathroom. I don't think that house keeping understands what a vacuum is, I get it I am at the beach, but sand on the floor the minute I get there!!! Plus my girls took off their shoes and you should have seen how dirty their feet were!!! Also for a hotel that bragged about just remodeling, they should really clean up the mold in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY!!”
Reviews.Author: momtojakob
Reviews.Content: We have been to OC a million times and I we will not be returning to this hotel. First I found dried blood on the cover of my bed that was not mine, our floor had sand on it when we arrived, the ac vent was covered with dust and dirt,the bath tub was too dirty to give our son a bath in. My husband found 2 mattresses in the stairwell along with trash and a very bad smell of urine. You can hear everything from the hallway which made it hard to sleep.Good luck with parking, if you move you will have to park to blocks away. The list goes on and on. The only thing that was decent was the view and location, we were able to see the fireworks on Tuesday from our balcony. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Read the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: CML_1982
Reviews.Content: Seriously, read the reviews. That is EXACTLY what the hotel representative told us on the phone when we cancelled our reservation. The service and their response to the reviews alone on this website should be an indicator of the quality of this hotel. Thank you Tripadvisor and fellow contributors. I am sad to say that out of all of the great places I have visited and not left an amazing review, the way in which we were treated from this hotel has compelled me to write this and to warn other people of our experience. Here is a little back story of our experience. I will disclose 100% we did not even get to the point of staying at this hotel. We were very excited to find such a great deal to book a hotel on the boardwalk on the beach the week following Labor Day. I grew up in Maryland and now live out West and I was very excited to get back and vacation in Ocean City. My mother went ahead and found this great deal and looked at the hotels website and it looked nice! She went ahead and booked the room. After further research and vacation planning, we found all of the Tripadvisor reviews and I became very hesitant about staying at this hotel. I trust Tripadvisor as well as the opinion of fellow travelers. This was going to be our first time traveling with our 15 month old and staying at a hotel and the mere thought of bed bugs, ants, and mold scared me, a lot. So... after lots of deliberation, we decided to cancel our reservation and find a different hotel. We are all aware of their cancellation fee and my husband decided to call and speak with someone being that it is June and the reservation was not until September. With the more than adequate amount of time between cancellation and the actual reservation, we were hoping there would be forgiveness with this fee. But there wasn't and we are happy to pay them money to NOT stay at their establishment. Here is a recap of my husband's conversation with a very rude representative of the hotel when he called to cancel the reservation: My husband called and told the representative who answered the phone that we were cancelling the reservation due to horrible reviews on Tripadvisor and brought it up to her that we were cancelling early enough that we probably should not not have to pay the cancellation fee (10% of your deposit). The representative told him that it was their policy to charge the fee. My husband then asked her is she had seen the Tripadvisor reviews and then proceeded to tell the very rude representative that it was OUR Family's POLICY not to stay in bug infested rooms. Her response was " YOU SHOULD HAVE CHECKED TRIPADVISOR BEFORE YOU BOOKED." Are you kidding me? This is the response a representative told us. Makes us think these reviews are 100% accurate, listen to what this hotel representative is telling you. CHECK & READ THEM. We let them know that we would be putting a comment on Tripadvisor for them regarding their quality of customer service. My husband then told the representative to go ahead and keep that $16 (thankfully it was that little) & that it was worth every penny since it means we were not staying there. He let her know that we were SOOOO glad to find out the quality of service they provide PRIOR to the stay. My husband concluded the conversation and told her thanks for the fantastic customer service & hope she enjoys working in a bug infested 'crap hole' of a hotel. Yes, a little rude on our behalf, however you too would get frustrated with the situation. Educate yourself and look around before booking. There are LOTS of options in OC, MD.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: 799Nonya
Reviews.Content: We had no AC during the entire time - 3 seperate calls and it still would not work, nor would they move us to a different room. When I asked for a fan they tried telling me no. At about 11:30 pm the front desk called to tell me they have a fan for us. When it got there it had so much dust on it - I had to run it in a different direction. The elevator needs to be seriously looked at - it gave a few extra shakes - we started taking the stairs to be safe. Don't waste your money!!!! It was the worst 3 nights ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Annoying”
Reviews.Author: Kim J
Reviews.Content: I only stayed in this hotel for one night - THANK GOODNESS! First, the room we paid for was advertised as "bay view," which it definitely was not. We were on the second floor, and had a great view... of the street. If we had paid for "street view," I wouldn't have cared, but come on! Perhaps the people on the fifth floor were luckier. Our room was dirty, the door didn't lock, our toilet ran, the walls were paper thin (which, between the rowdy neighbors and traffic, made it impossible to sleep), and the room smelled like old garbage when we first arrived. The ONLY good thing about this hotel is the location. Do yourself a favor and book somewhere else. Yuck.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location, Service and Pool Bar!”
Reviews.Author: M K
Reviews.Content: My two kids, husband and I stayed here for 3 nights for the Sand Duels soccer tournament. The hotel was great! It was clean, kitchennette was great, recently remodeled and they even had dish towel, kitchen towel and dish soap! We had an ocean view room and the 2 king beds and sleep sofa were great - and the room was REALLY spacious! We absolutely loved the pool and pool bar - the food at the pool bar was great as well! We ended up having breakfast and 2 lunches there! Great service all around! Will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “NOT GOOD!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cack30
Reviews.Content: Bedbugs in our first room, then they switched us to another room, seemed to be okay. They never came to clean our room or make the beds the whole 3 nights we were there. We had to ask for clean towels and toilet paper when we saw the maid in the hallway. And we asked her if she can come and make our beds and she said yes and never came to do it. I have never been to a hotel that has never made a bed or came into freshen everything up. Just Terrible. Would not recommend this hotel to anybody!!!

Reviews.Title: “Your Mileage May Vary!”
Reviews.Author: JBB02
Reviews.Content: I stayed in an Ocean Front room and enjoyed my stay mostly. There are just of annoying details that bug most people about this place: DVD player hooked up incorrectly which does not work with the remote, cheap/small bed pillows, no hot water on the first day, fan in bathroom barely works, sorta lumpy bed, room not well insulated for noise from adjacent rooms, cheap quality towels, etc. Management/office/maid staff were friendly and responsive (for things they could fix).

Reviews.Title: “Only positive thing is the location”
Reviews.Author: beachbug69
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this property for Cruisin' OC weekend (May 18-20, 2012). We booked 2 rooms as we were traveling with another couple. The first problem was that we had no hot water for 4 hours from the time we checked in. My friend called 3 times before we were actually told that it was being fixed. The first 2 calls were answered with "ok, thank you". What kind of a response is that? The second problem were the safes in both rooms. Neither of them worked. When we called the front desk on Saturday morning we were told that there was not enough staff to allow them to leave the desk to reset them. This is a huge event weekend and you would think that there would be plenty of staff scheduled. Not to mention that we were being charged $8.75 for use of the safe. So I ended up having to carry my valuables with me for the entire car show weekend. The third problem: our friends had ants in the room by Saturday afternoon. And not just a few. They had to throw food away because ants were crawling in everything. The fourth problem: you have to pay for ice! I am a travel agent and have stayed in hotels all over the world. I have never paid for ice!!! That is just ridiculous! We paid $217.60 per night to stay here. The bathrooms are the equivalent of a Motel 6. There is mildew, missing grout and very little water pressure. For a few more dollars per night I can stay in Jamaica at an all-inclusive. This was our third stay here over the course of approximately 6 years. I had no complaints during our first stay. I did notice decline in the property during the second stay. But I believe in always giving more than one chance. After this last stay I can say that we will never return. The worst part is that I contacted the resort via info@tidelandscaribbean.com and requested the general manager's name and contact information. I explained in my email that I am a travel agent and that I specialize in group trips. I sent that email on Monday morning. This is Thursday and I have not received any response. The customer service at this property is extremely lacking. The location is excellent for event weekends but that is the only positive. Oh and make sure you check-in as soon as they allow. The overflow parking lot is quite a walk. This hotel is definitely not worth the price they charge.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend at ths hotel two months ago. The rooms are spacious and the staff is very helpful and friendly. However, we did find bed bugs in our beds and on the walls. I went downstairs to the front desk and informed the lady at the counter that we had bed bugs and that I wanted a full refund. Not one person from the staff went to our room to check if there were actual bed bugs. When we told the lady at the front desk, she did not question us or even ask surprised. It seemed like a normal complaint from guests. I was granted a full refund. At the 11:00pm we had to leave our room and go search for a hotel with vacancies. The management at this hotel should be ashamed of themselves. How can you 'testify' that you have no bed bugs when you did not even check our room? Do yourself a favor and avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Tidelands Caribean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anthony W
Reviews.Content: A couple of friends and I shared a suite which was excellent other than the beds are very firm; a pillow top is highly recommended during their next upgrade. The suite was two areas separated by the stove, frig and microwave across from the bathroom entrance. Some balconies were longer, but all were a nice size for the room type. They have two separate buildings that are not connected. Sufficient parking is not available despite having two additional parking lots across the street which one is used by the patrons of another hotel. It is conveniently located on the boardwalk next to Hooters (I do not recommend) and underneath the hotel on the boardwalk is Dunkin Donuts and a couple of shops that is convenient. I would stay here again, it is near the beginning of the boardwalk when you enter the beach area with many things to do along the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “great location on board walk”
Reviews.Author: fordman02
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a great location on ocean city MD boardwalk, but that is all i can say about our stay this time. the people that stayed there were very roude and loud, all nite and i am talking all nite. 8:00 pm uitil 3:30 am. told the front desk three different nites about the noise and they did nothing. the made left our door open three times also. front desk again did nothing. we really did like the hotel in years past but we have changed ore minds on this stay. just a helpful though.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: flyinburrito
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at Tidelands April 28th and 29th. We ran in the OC 1/2 marathon so the location was great since the race started at the inlet parking lot. Rooms were just okay. Is was clean but shows age. Location was great and that's what you pay for. Check in was terrible and the front desk woman didn't seem to know a lot. We had 2 cars and she said only one parking pass per room but couldn't help when I asked were can I park. She said on one of the streets. They have overflow parking right across the street that was empty I guess she didn't know that. Check out was good but it was a different person. My rate was $120 per night through Expedia. Now there is no way I would pay the summer rate of $250-300 per night. It's just not worth it. But for what I needed and the price it was fine this time. Just don't expect top service and awesome rooms and you'll be ok.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy Rooms, Dirty, Great Staff, Horrible Owner!”
Reviews.Author: matthewsmitty
Reviews.Content: We got there early and were able to check in early. The front desk girls were great. They were sweet and very quick. While I was checking in, a lady who informed me she was the owner handed me a paper to fill out on this website about what I liked about the hotel.I won't say her name but it starts with an "A" BEWARE! When we finally got to the room, the room was not clean - mold and dust and dirt everywhere, but we called to the front desk and the housekeeper came up and scrubbed the floor for us and around the tub. Although this shouldn't have to happen, since the rooms should already be clean, we didn't complain since she worked her butt off. The hot water never got hot. The AC didn't work. Never did the heat. We asked for a blanket, but of course they were out of those as well. I later went down to the lobby to sit and wait on my husband. They at least have a nice tv and couch to sit on. I proceeded to listen to the owner scold one of the girls at the front desk for not making a sale. I mean really? I work in customer service so I know how it is. You can't make someone buy a room they don't want. It was very unprofessional of the owner to treat her in that manner AT ALL but, especially in front of guests staying in the hotel. You can definitely tell, the only thing she is there for is to claim her money. Those poor workers definitely have a boss from hell!! The location is perfect, It's close to everything. Boardwalk is great. Love the beach. I would love to give a good review about this hotel, but there isn't much to say. I wouldn't give another cent to this hotel for that rude woman to spend on her 50,000 car! HA

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly staff, Great location, Horrible Rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: Gobigorgohome90
Reviews.Content: My room was horrible. The mattresses are so bad it would of benefited more to go sleep on the beach. The website says the hotel was recently updated, what a LIE!! The only good things are the staff was very friendly and helpful. I booked my room with Trista and she gave me a great discount. She was extremely informative and easy to talk too. I also called back to extend my stay and I talked to Latoya I believe was her name. She was very helpful as well. Also the location is perfect. But if you're looking for a clean comfortable room, don't go here. For a hotel that is so pricey in the summer, you'd think they would have better beds you know?

Reviews.Title: “False advertisement but, had a goods time there.”
Reviews.Author: beachperson83
Reviews.Content: I booked a nice little weekend getaway in march at this hotel online. Booked oceanfront due to the fact it was early in the season and rates where fairly cheap. Arrived there Friday night to check in and the young man at the office said, "I had called the number u provided us to tell you that there is no hot water in the oceanfront units so we upgraded you to a 2 room suite." Well first never had a message on the home phone, even checked the phone once I returned home form the beach, no message. So after he said this I thought oh that's great! (Oh n he said were only charging you the same rate) So we walk up to the suite he had gave us the card to get into and the room for and it wasn't even cleaned yet. Ok, not a real big deal because, like I said previously it was early in the season so the hotel wasn't full of people on vacation so there were plenty of empty units. So I went down explained n he had given us another room, which was just next to the room that was not cleaned. Nice rooms, can't say they weren't clean, they were. Overall nice place besides that minor inconvenience and would stay again. On Saturday I looked on there website to see the oceanfront rooms and the 2 room suites are the same exact rate all season long so, he really didn't give us a deal like he tried to make it sound. On top of that Saturday morning we all went for a bike ride n took notice the front building, with the oceanfront views had not opened for the season yet! So checking out Sunday morning I asked ,"so when do you open up the oceanfront units?" He said, they opened next weekend (St. Pattys weekend) oh, it was the same guy that was there when I checked in. So he lied.......kinda I guess u could say. The thing is there website was listing oceanfront rooms for rental. I should have complained but, didn't wanna ruin the weekend. I would stay there again cause, afterall it was a nice place, balcony could see the ocean n the bay. Just think he could have been upfront with me and not make it sound like he was given me a deal or break on the 2 room suit.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Alexmack24
Reviews.Content: Loved the location and size of room. Cleaning staff was very polite. Discovered LOTS of bedbugs on our second night. Check before you sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jen D
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed at Tidelands Caribbean hotel in late august 2011. I must say that the location was perfect for our family. Having three young children we found that being on the boardwalk is perfect for us. The kids love to run out on the beach early in the morning and we can keep an eye on them from our ocean front room. We booked one with a small kitchen and other than it did not have a freezer it was perfect for our needs. The hotel was about ten blocks away from all of the amusements and that made it an easy walk home at night when the kids were exhausted. We called the hotel directly and got a great 5 night special which actually came out cheaper than any online special that we had seen for this hotel. The room was ready upon our early arrival at noon and found that the room was clean and comfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So so experience”
Reviews.Author: jcheskay
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and daughter have been staying at Tideland for the past four years. The first year we loved it, but yes it has become very run down.
