I am considering going back again but after reading some reviews, I'm not so sure. We usually stay in an oceanfront room right over Dunk in Donuts. We love to wake up to the view of the water while drinking coffee. The bed is very sunken in, old, and squeaky. The ice machines never work so we accepted three years ago we would be buying ice every day. Whatever. The location is perfect, that's what brings us back. We never had a problem with pool chairs but have never stayed on the weekend. The pool and grill keep us co,among back to. The girl that worked there worked her but off and remembered us every day. Tidelands does not want to lose her!!! They should however lower the prices or do an upgrade. The place is going down fast which is a shame because of the location and potential. Oh and the staff os so unattentive!!! Rude and uncaring. And that's four years of going there!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay!”
Reviews.Author: Courthalecki6
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 2 nights, but they were good. We faced the street and besides the noisy immature boys next door it was great. Everything was clean and the beds were kinda comfy. Wonderful location & a nice trip overall!

Reviews.Title: “Mold and peeling in room.”
Reviews.Author: rn4premies
Reviews.Content: Mold and peeling paint in room. TV broken - electrical outlets not working. Manager not available during his regular shift. Avoid this poor excuse of a hotel. Mold can be very dangerous!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never AGAIN!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela A
Reviews.Content: What has happened to the Tidelands Carribean Hotel!! I have enjoyed coming to this hotel for 9 years, however I was extremely disappointed with my hotel experience this last & final time. Upon entering my non-smoking room I found a cigarette lighter at the head of the bed. I questioned the housekeeper about this, whom recognized the lighter to be owned by one of her coworkers. Later, I discovered a decomposing condom and guaze dressing on the floor at the foot of the bed. I reported it to the manager whom promptly had 2 housekeepers come to the room and sweep them away. Feeling like the room had not been properly cleaned, I spoke to the front desk about a room transfer. The manager said the room transfer seemed unnecessary as the debris on the floor had been resolved with housekeeping. I was persistent and was given a new room. The second room had issues as well. The television did not work, electrical outlets in the kitchenette & front room had no power. There was black mold all around the tub & floor. The bathtub drain did not empty. After 2 calls to the front desk to empty out the tub, a maintenance person came to the room whom resolved the drain problem by using the room's nasty toilet plunger. I can't think of anything that contains more germs than a toilet plunger,..Really!! Frustrated and not scheduled to leave until the following day, I promptly packed up my belongings and set out to talk with the manager. Three face to face attempts over the span of 2 hours was unsuccessful. The manager never showed up for work and the front desk personnel was at a loss as to how to contact him. I was given his voicemail extension, but was unable to leave a message as his mailbox was full. I left my phone number at the front desk for the manager whom never called.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible room”
Reviews.Author: kittygirl519
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I'm from the Jersey Shore, all my life, and worked as a chambermaid through highschool in some of the rattiest motels in Seaside Heights. That being said, this place was by far, the dirtiest rundown, smelliest, uncared for motel I've ever been in. I'm not some yuppie who expects a 5 start room for a 1 star price, but jeez, this place was bad. The housekeeping staff were very nice, but didn't do a great job. The front desk staff was unfriendly, and the whole place just had an air of mismanagement. Too bad, place could be great, it's right on the boardwalk, close to some bars, nice views. Just dirty and rundown. Room 511, the only room on the 5th floor without a cooktop, or a table to sit at! We had to use the ironing board for a table! Our neighbors in 510 had a kitchenette, a fold out couch, and a table. 511 is the only room in that hallway considered 'ocean block' not 'ovean view' so book carefully!

Reviews.Title: “love this place. will stay there now and forever.....”
Reviews.Author: alison d
Reviews.Content: hey there. i stay at the tidelands carribean hotel and suites with my mom, step dad, myself and my daughter who is three. i have to say besides the weather being fanastic, the hotel was awesome. we stay at a two room suite so we had a city view. my daughter and i had one side of the suite and my mom and step dad had the other side. we also had a kitchenette and sofa bed that wouldve come out to a bed had we needed it. we were on the second floor and were steps away from the pool and outdoor grille and bar. the bar/grille was awesome. the owner was very nice, the food was amazing and not bad for the price and the mixed drinks were delicious. it was nice to be at the bar/grille eat lunch then swim in the pool while listening to great music. they had a stereo on the whole time. the pool wasnt too cold either.. the rooftop pool wasnt bad either but it was more convenient for us to use the other pool on the second floor. the view of the city wasnt bad either. ob. ocean front wouldve been better but we needed the two room suite so city view wasnt bad either. not only were we steps away from the boardwalk but also good places to eat as hooters is right next door. all in all a great vacation and when i go to ocean city i will always book at the tidelands. there is no other hotel for me.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms, poor/mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: GusAntonello
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Tidelands with my wife and my Mom on the Labor day holiday. We chose that hotel despite the "so-so" reviews that we read. I wanted to be in a hotel very close to the sidewalk so I wouldn't need to use the car to take a walk on the boardwalk. That's why we decided to stay in this place. Overall it was not bad, but some things annoyed us. Every time someone closed their doors on the same floor, it slammed and the walls shook as if we were in an earthquake. That happened frequently. The towels were not replaced when we requested and the bed was poorly made, the bedsheets were all wrinkled as if they had just covered the messed bedsheet with the comforter. They did not clean the dirty mugs/glasses, and when we called asking them to do it, they said they did not do it. The bathroom is small and the showers are as weak as a little stream. There's only one elevator and it's definitely not the fastest I've ever been. Get used to wait in the line. The only Ice machine of the hotel was broken and the front desk charged us 1 dollar for a bag of ice. This was the first time I've been to a hotel where I had to pay for the ice. The parking lot, depending on how crowded the hotel is, gets full and you have to park 2 blocks away. The rooms are clean and tiled, no carpet, and the beds are ok, which is very important to us. One of the comforters had a huge hole and the bathroom door was damaged as well. The balcony is nice and has a good view. The staff is not rude, although not friendly at all. They seem not oriented to please the customers.The day we checked out, for example, I asked to keep the car in the garage for a little longer, up until 3ish. The guys said they couldn't do it because there were other customers checking in starting @ 3. I tried to argument and ask him to give me a call in case the lot got full but he insisted that I should remove the car by 2 at the latest. I was surprised because there were plenty of empty spaces, and it was the Labor Day Monday, so I really don't think the hotel would be 100% occupied in the night when the summer had officially ended. I took the car out of the parking lot and parked on the street. We usually go to OC and stay in hotels and this was the first time this happened. So, in a nuthsell, there are better options to go in OC, this one is not a "no-go" but if you decide to stay there get an extra dose of patience. The only thing that raised the rating was the location and the clean rooms. The rest is below any standards for the price they charge you.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to go back next year!”
Reviews.Author: tar4963
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an oceanfront room with a wonderful balcony that we really enjoyed. Our room was very big and even though we did not use the kitchen - it was nice to have it. The pools are very nice with comfy lounge chairs. Great location on the boardwalk - close to everything. Only negative was that the room was a little dusty, but we can live with that!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: skadeb
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel back in March for my daughter 3rd birthday in August. I had kept coming back reading all of the bad reviews thinking to myself "what am I in for?!" Was not bad at all!! The room was great we had oceanfront. Noise from stores at bottom not bad, we all slept through it. Bathroom not great, little moldy but expected from boardwalk hotels Service was awesome! No complaints. We would return here, my daughter loved it.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we are back and will go back next year”
Reviews.Author: NyTanfan
Reviews.Content: so we just came back from a week long stay at the hotel. what can i say love, love , love everything about it. the location is right on the beach and we traveled with three kids so it was ideal for us and all the stuff we had to carry to the beach. we had a two bedroom suite with a small kitchen that had a two burner stove top, sink and cabinet space. they also give you plates and pots and utencils but I prefer to bring my own . we brought our own pack and play this year but last year we used one from the hotel which was fine. We will for sure go back same time next year it was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is great location!”
Reviews.Author: Deborah B
Reviews.Content: Saw some of the bad reviews but decided to give it a try - big mistake. Upon arrival noticed no bath towels and had to ask for them. Staff was very nice and delivered them to the room. Once we were back in the room noticed dirty floor, black mold in caulk in bathroom, mold on shower curtain and ceiling tiles in the bathroom. Toilet in bathroom not bolted to floor well-felt extremely wobbly. Internet service was useless, broken ice maker on floor. If I needed ice I could go to lobby or pay for an 8 lb. bag. Rooftop pool not clean and had algae on the tiles.

Reviews.Title: “KEEP AWAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: Thomas J
Reviews.Content: Got a two room suite for $275 a night. Walked into the room, light switch wasn't working and room smelled like smoke. Told the front desk, they said 'the lamps may be unplugged' (what??) and 'it's a non smoking floor', like I was lying to them or something. So they switched my room, and that one smelled worse, and lights did not go on there either! Floor was tile throughout, which did not give the room a cozy feel at all. I immediately went down to the desk and got a full refund. Could not (nor would not) stay there. Disgusting and WAY overpriced. Would not recommend to ANYONE.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled”
Reviews.Author: J W
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the attractive photo of the pool, etc. If you haven't paid absolute top dollar for an ocean view suite, you have paid a lot of money to be in a not very well maintained room down a musty hall with a view of the equally cheesy hotel across the street. (The sink in our room was held up by a 2x6 board.) I'd advise anyone curious about the OC boardwalk scene to stay somewhere else -- the further north you go toward Rehoboth the better -- and come visit for one night only.

Reviews.Title: “Great view , will be back”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: Overall it was nice . Staff nice . Was on 5 floor and did not like the height . Moved us the next morning to the 3 floor . As for the room it was ok , bed little soft and some mildue . We all have some mildue in our own houses and still live there . Overall its a great location and will be back in 2012 .

Reviews.Title: “COPS HAD TO COME TO THE HOTEL SEVERAL TIMES”
Reviews.Author: FineDining2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nightand five days, the hotel is very high priced for what you recieve and I'm not happy that my stay was not child friendly, Bad lauguage into the morning hours, hallways yelling into the AM. On Saturday the police had been called in several times up to 12 at night. We were told it was for the smell of pot, I don't know why the rooms withthe people were not told to leave ...I stayed in room 329 the sink woyld not drain, the lights in the bathroom are so dim my wife could not shave in the shower...,,,for 260.00 a night it was a nightmare.....The bar was decent

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: JessicaOfVA
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed here for the 4th of July weekend. It was an awesome deal. There were 2 king sized beds and a sleeper sofa, so we were able to have 6 people in one room. We couldn't find anywhere else where we could have 6 people in one room. It's right there on the boardwalk so you can just leave your room and walk to restaurants, shops, rides, and games. The room was clean and well furnished. It has a little mini kitchen that comes stocked with dishes to use. We had an ocean view room with a small balcony. Our room was right across from the elevator but we didn't have much of an issue with noise. Though honestly we spent most of our time out in town, not in the hotel room. The only issue I really had was when we requested bedding for the sleeper sofa. We waited for a couple hours and didn't get it. When I went back to the front desk, they had had a shift change over and the lady that was there then had some attitude. It was obvious that she was having to deal with several things that weren't completed by the last shift, but in the Customer Service field you should always treat your customers with respect and consideration. No matter what issues you have with your co-workers. But other than that one small bump, we had a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT”
Reviews.Author: mom10111
Reviews.Content: This was the 4th and last time we will stay at the Tidelands..huge disappointment from prior years. Bathroom floor dirty..there was a dirty bar of soap behind toilet when we got there and we asked to have floor scrubbed next day..guess what...still there when we returned. I was in lobby asking for more towels and there were three different people complaining to the staff on different issues. While we did enjoy pool bar, the music played half the night and we couldn't sleep, not to mention a bikini clad girl laying on bar as patrons did body shots from her as kids and familes were in the pool. Electric on one side of room only worked when they came to fix twice...all of our food was ruined in the frig. Manager didn't seem too apologetic either. Unclean suites...will never go back, not sure what happened to this place. There are plenty of other hotels in OC! Hallway had bad odor and no ice machine that I saw worked. We had to purchase ice from outdoor ice cooler.

Reviews.Title: “Okay not great”
Reviews.Author: LarkShadySide_Md
Reviews.Content: We had 4 of our granddaugters on this trip.The ice vending machines were not working .Ttherefore must purchase ice daily.Refrigerator, no real ice compartment in refrig .If set temp everything froze.No ice bucket. To much noise in the hall ways until two am to sleep. Jacuzzi didn't work. House keeping knew there were 6 of us but only supplied 4 towels no bathmats no kitcken towels or kitchen dishes for us unless we called to ask. with paying over $1000.00 I expected more. Three nights/4days I'm glad it wasn't a week parking was not adiquite..We were told we would be on the side street view of the ocean. but not told it would be in the 2nd building block. I give the hotel a 1.8

Reviews.Title: “Great time and room”
Reviews.Author: ManorDoc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a weeks stay. The room was very spacious and the air conditioner worked perfectly. This was especially needed since it was probably the hottest week of the summer. The Blue Fin bar had great breakfast and Kevin was especially helpful.We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: Morticia814
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure whether to go 2 or 3 stars on this hotel....maybe 2.5 would be more appropriate. I will upgrade to 3 just b.c of the pool bar and food. While I don't think i had as bad of experience as the other travellers, I was disappointed in the detoriation of the hotel. I stayed there back in the late 90's and I agree, nothing has been renovated. We arrived about 1:30 and although hotels usually state check in at 3, I've never had a problem checking in early. But in this case we had to come back. So we tried to park and there was no parking in the hotel parking lot...at all....EVER.... the entire 4 days. We had to park across the street in the overflow lot, not too happy. We had a room overlooking the pool, which was good and bad. Good to people watch but bad when you wanted to go to bed because it was VERY loud after hours due to the pool bar. Friday night especially, very loud, very late. (if it wasn't a family vacation I wouldn't have minded and have probably been down there myself). It did sound like fun. The hallways were pretty loud late too but maybe cuz we had the vending machines right outside our door. I did think the room smelled immediately upon entering...just something you had to get used to. The bed was pretty shabby. One sheet and the bedspread....are you kidding? Did you expect me to use the bedspread as a cover?? Does ANYONE watch Oprah??!! But they were accomodating in bringing me extra blankets. I actually thought the staff was helpful and attentive. They left us extra towels without asking when they noticed we had 4 in the room. The air conditioning worked great but the water pressure in the shower was the pits! Another MAJOR complaint.....we got up at 6:30am and ALL of the pool chairs already had towels on them!! We went to the waterpark because there would have been no where to sit. That shouldn't be allowed. Obviously these people aren't showing up until 9 or 10 am....you pay $300 a night and you can't even get a chair by the pool....that was a little intolerable. I will say...positively.....the pool bar was pretty cool and I loved anything i ordered to eat from there. All the bartenders were nice and they have poolside waitress service and the girl is a doll. It was very convenient having that all right there. My son who is 6 had a great time in the pool with other kids he met. Overall, I wouldn't go back but i guess it could have been worse. Not having enough pool chairs or letting people reserve them and then not showing up for hours was frustrating

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: Tom1945
Reviews.Content: Did not enjoy our stay because of the very poor service.Stayed for 3 days and had to beg for clean towels every day.Maid never emptied trash cans.Complained about making the beds.Had to have the card keys reprogrammed several times because they wouldn't open the door after we went out and came back to the room.Ice machine was broken.Had to go to the lobby for ice.Floor was filthy(no carpet....tile floor).Will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book it”
Reviews.Author: HBel1225
Reviews.Content: Great location and thats about it! Room/bathroom was dirty when we got there and never got any better. Had to asks for towels and ice only at the front desk. Staff ok, but not worth the money if you go don't book an ocean front, not worth it. Both pool area were so dirty even my kids didn't want to swim there, very small too. To many other choices.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: ebbie7
Reviews.Content: date:10 july 2011 one hot,run down,slow, elevator with everyone including staff having to use it.The staff had an attitude as well as some guests.Numerous complainers at desk so we went to room to call down to front desk about water in our bed.They did finally move us but the evening was shot.Very small and drty pool.We frequent Ocean City will never stay there again. .

Reviews.Title: “Won't be Back, Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: zman648
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at Tidelands 7/1-7/5, every day I had an issue of some sort. Whomever was in charge of cleaning my room each day was terrible, no clean towels, never cleaned the floor, left trash on the floor. My 2nd night there the A/C stopped working, when I called the front desk I got a woman with attitude and a smart mouth. Very Disappointed....

Reviews.Title: “Good location, moldy room, Assistant GM that doesn't call you back!”
Reviews.Author: banker112
Reviews.Content: Location was great and staff was friendly. Room was clean except for the bathroom. Definitely a mold problem. 3rd floor in general has a mold problem. Bed was sagging in the middle. Alerted the front desk who said they would put a note on the reservation to move us the following morning and never called us. Upon check out, spoke with the night auditor. She gave me the assistant GM, Paul Kahn's card and said she would email him and asked me to call after 9 am that morning. Did so and he wasn't available to talk. Left a message and more than 24 hours later and he hasn't called back. Poor service on his part. BEWARE if you decide to stay here. Coming back in the Fall and staying in a much nicer place. Also in the process of disputing the charges on my credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Do not use their pool!”
Reviews.Author: travelsalotKofP
Reviews.Content: Should have realized that when you have a bar at the pool, there will be guys using it as a bathroom! I'm surprised that by the end of our stay that the pool water wasn't yellow, that's how bad it was. The pool and bar are open to the public, one guy passed out and slept by the pool all night. Some of the sites that were going on by the pool will probably be posted on You Tube in the near future. Definitely not meant for families. Room was nice but needs a lot of updating. Location is good, but they lead you to believe that you'll be beach front, they also have a building behind the main building that's were the pool & bar are.There were 6 of us in the 2 room suite and were only given 4 towels, no sheets or blankets for the pull out sofa. When we asked we were told that there were no towels! Called down to the desk and got the towels that we needed... Stay some place else if you have a choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with great views!”
Reviews.Author: Thwapper
Reviews.Content: Let's face it: you don't come to Ocean City to stay in the hotel all day. The Tidelands Caribbean sits on 5th street, right on the Boardwalk. There is a Dunkin' Donuts and Polock Johnny's beneath the hotel. You are within walking distance of LOTS of great shops, rides, and of course, the beach. Hooters is right next door. All the noise you would expect from this is silenced with shutting the sliding glass door, too! As for the hotel, the rooms are a good size for 4 people. The oceanfront rooms have a small balcony, comfortable for 2 people-watchers. The beds were hard. All of the appliances were kept clean and worked properly. The bathroom was a bit on the small size, but served its purpose. The pools are both clean and in great shape! The free wi-fi was VERY slow, so don't expect to stream any movies or even go on youtube. The only thing I didn't like about the place was the hard tile floors. I understand why the rooms are not carpeted, but as I watched my 2-year slip and slam his head on the floor coming in off of the wet balcony, I wondered why they didn't at least have a floor mat or something by the doors. Other than that, the place is in a great location and provides a nice room at a decent price!

Reviews.Title: “Attitude adjustment needed”
Reviews.Author: mrsratman
Reviews.Content: While we have never stayed at the Tidelands.....Unfortunately I had already booked a room for this June and then checked this website for reviews. When I called to cancel my reservations I was told very sacasticly that they have no control over people who have "a bone to pick with them" and if I chose to believe it then he would cancel my reservation minus the 10% service fee. I lost about 20 dollars in this deal but feel it is worth it. I picked this hotel in the beginning because we are taking my grandson along with us and I wanted him to experience being right on the boardwalk. So instead I booked again at a motel that we stayed at last year.

Reviews.Title: “Old but clean facility”
Reviews.Author: jrboct24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2010 carshow and chose this location because of the boardwalk parade. We wanted an oceanfront balcony. Not a bad place to stay but it is old and needs a good paint job in all the rooms. The beds are very comfy and hotel staff very friendly. No ice machines which can be an inconvenience because you have to take your ice bucket down to the hotel check in every time you need to refill or you can puchase a small bag of ice for $1.00. The place was very convenient to the boardwalk activities and within walking distance of many local events. I would possibly stay here again unless I could rent from a more updated facility @the same cost as this was.

Reviews.Title: “great location,helpful staff,large rooms.Not the Waldorf, but good value”
Reviews.Author: mmottola
Reviews.Content: Loved the oceanview room we had. I was disappointed in the room I rented for my son and d-i-l.(room 523) Felt like the oceanfront rooms were much nicer. The hotel is old, but our room was comfortable. The ice machine was not running and there could be a bit more sprucing up done to bring the hotel up to the next level. Parking was tough on Sat. night and we parked at a meter on the street . Cant beat the location!You have nice staff and they did what they could to assist us. Would and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy and great location but the rooms are run down”
Reviews.Author: deltaflyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tidelands 4 years ago and stayed again this past weekend for Sunfest. From the outside, the hotel still presents well but the rooms have really deteriorated. They need painted badly, pillowcases and towels were stained and grayish, both beds were very hard and squeaked loudly with every move and the shower pressure was very, very low. Early the morning of our last day, the AC fan started squeaking. Finding a parking spot on site was difficult still in September because of Sunfest. Our room was facing the street so it was very noisy. On the upside, the rooms are large and ours had a jacuzzi tub which was nice but took a long time to fill because of low water pressure. The desk employees were friendly and allowed us to check in early. The pool and pool bar looked inviting but that is not enough for me to book again. I will try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “RUN AS FAST & AS FAR AS YOU CAN!”
Reviews.Author: 3patrick3
Reviews.Content: What happened to this place?! Mold, dirt, broken beds, no wash cloths, foul smell, splashed walls & ceiling,bugs in the tub, black curly hairs, leaking trash bag in the elevator, dirt/sand lining each side of the hallway, unsecure building, staff who could care less! PLEASE do yourself & your family a favor and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “A customer service dissappointment!”
Reviews.Author: mperks127
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay. Broken air conditioning upon arrival to room. Had to switch to suite with a different view. Took 2 hours to get an ashtray. Difficulty getting adequate linen & the "clean" washcloths were stained. Our hallway was very hot, little or no air conditioning and wreaked of old seafood smell. No attempt to remedy either when reported. Our balcony chairs were cracked & unsafe. Chaise lounges at rooftop pool broke & unsafe & area was unkempt. Overall cleanliness & maintenance gets maybe a "5" & that's generous. Desk staff certainly not zealous to serve you.` Like location but probably won't stay a third time! We're low maintenance just looking for decent customer service, cleanliness & a safe environment. TOO MUCH TO ASK??????

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: shortyjame
Reviews.Content: We were here for 5 days and was very unhappy when we first got there because there was absolutely no parking and they expected us to park 2 blocks down where you had to pay for parking!! Absolutely not, I already paid $700 for 5 days I was not about to pay to park. We had an ocean view room with 2 king b eds and a pull out sofa. The maid service was terrible and we constantly had to remind them for towels and such. The floor is all tile and when we checked in the floor was filled with sand and it was never ever swept. The water pressure in the shower is horrible, not hot and it took forever to get a shower. The hotel staff was not very friendly nor helpful at all. The pictures posted online are very deceiving, please do not believe them. I was very upset that I spent so much money and found all these problems.

Reviews.Title: “serious decline”
Reviews.Author: sunbum13
Reviews.Content: we have stayed here numerous times in the past years, this was terrible!! dirty and moldy! upon entering found both beds in suite broken!! maitenence did come to fix supports, but cant believe housekeeping didnt notice when they made up the room. one day there were cleaning supplies left in bathroom but no towels, guess someone was in a hurry. refrigerator didnt work so housekeeping had to use hair dryer to defrost. no ice machines. and the worst staircase ever!! complained to desk numerous times about no lights in staircase and terrible smell. the manager Paul was never available to talk to. i did e-mail the Tidelands upon our return, with no response of course.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving....”
Reviews.Author: XmareX78
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel cause it seemed clean and nice from the outside. Believe the bad reviews and no people are not being snotty and expecting the Hilton. When you pay over $230 for one night you expect certain things. One would expect a blanket on the beds and not just some flimsy comforter that looks like it hasnt been washed in years. I wore my flipflops in the shower and bascially the whole time we were in the room. The pool is extremely small for a hotel that size. No out door shower, they ask that you not bring sand into the hotel well how about providing a "shower" or simply a hose for people to rinse off prior to entering the hotel. The bathroom in the pool area was utterly disguesting with not ventilation. Ice Machines are non existent and if you want ice you have to pay for it!! I have never ever had to pay for ice. One could go on and on.... My recommendation is to find another hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cookingpamiam
Reviews.Content: Have to agree with others this was not a good hotel. At first look it looks great when you see the size of the room and the king size beds. However, look a little closer and you will see the mold and mildew on the ceilings, tub and floor. The towels and washcloths were a dingy gray color. I don't think they ever saw and bleach. One of our room mates found pubic hair on the side of her sheets. The bathroom fan was so covered in dust that it couldn't have done a bit of good. The good was looked like it had been rinsed out and put away dirty. Anyone off of the street could gain access to any floor of the hotel just by walking in and taking the stairs or elevator, including the pool on the 5th floor and the bar side pool. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe all these snotty people's reviews!!!”
Reviews.Author: mausfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Aug. 20-23 and thought that overall it wasn't that bad at all. I went in with the lowest expectations because of all the negative reviews, but maybe I just got lucky. Our room was a pool view room on the 200 level. A friend and I whose family split a suit with us, went in first on reconnaissance to check for bedbugs, mold, and dirty floors. None of these were present. I'm curious if certain rooms are much worse than others. I believe there is a lot of people out there that expect every hotel to be a Ritz Carlton. I see a lot of complaints of a sandy floor and from our visit the sand was brought in from us. Since we read the reviews we knew to bring a swiffer mop to clean up our sand. All I can say is that there a lot of people that like to complain about everything. Overall we didn't have a negative experience and if you book through a discount website like we did, it was a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It !”
Reviews.Author: nmh1963
Reviews.Content: Very sad....this used to be a great place to stay !! The first time we booked this hotel it was so nice, clean and kept up daily that was four years ago, we have booked the pool view suite every year since. However, this time seemed like we were in the twilight zone, everything was so different The hotel has really gone down the drain, view from our balcony was a ledge right over the pool of what appeared to be a very old pair of socks and a bunch of old nasty trash. Nice view, uh ? The room size is perfect if it had only been clean, had a decent bed and wash cloth would have been a plus, the floors are all tile which is o.k. but again clean floors would have been nice. The shower was awful, no hot water or water pressure. No ice machines...you had to go to the front desk for a little bucket of ice or you could buy a bag from them if you wanted. After booking the same hotel for four years straight we will not be back ! Spent our last day in Ocean City looking at other hotels to book for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the bad reports.. disgusting would be nice way to put it”
Reviews.Author: bryanthomas
Reviews.Content: The entire hotel is filthy. They leave the stairwell door open all night so anyone off the boardwalk can walk right in and have access to all of the floors. The beds were worse than a college dormatory. The bathroom had missing tiles and mold. I was grossed out most of the time we were in the room. There are no ice machines. You can BUY ice from the front desk. No out door shower, just a foot rinse. We ordered lunch at the bluefin pool bar and 2 hours later were told the cook had taken a break and just got back. I paid 1400 for 4 nights. When I checked out there was no thank you, how was your stay... n o t h i n g. Would not stay here again if you paid me. SHAME ON ME FOR NOT READING TRIP ADVISOR BEFORE LETTING MY TRAVEL AGENT BOOK THIS.

Reviews.Title: “The Roach Hotel with a smell unknown to man”
Reviews.Author: funseekerMonroe_Ct
Reviews.Content: DO NOT stay at this hotel. We saw & heard multiple fights in other nearby rooms which explains the holes in the room we stayed in which by the way was a two bedroom suite!. The hotel is a dirty mess with bad water pressure, dirty towels when provided,stained bed sheets and a smell which is a smell unknown to man. The best description is a cross between garlic, low tide and vomit. Please DO NOT ignore the other previous posts like we did and go to the Comfort Inn next door for only a few bucks more, actually about the same cost with a AAA card. By the way, no operational ice machines exist at this hotel and want to charge you a buck for a bag of ice. How can you say SCAM!!! It's a shame because the location is a prime boardwalk location. No wonder the suite was offered at a 30% discount at the time and thought it was too go to pass up...... As the saying goes, we get what you pay for, which is certainly the case at the Tidelands !!!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: ToesNdeSand
Reviews.Content: I was suprised at the lack of attention to certain issues at the Tidelands. Our door would not shut all of the way or lock. We were told by the front desk not to worry about it. (this was a little bothersome) It's a great location, and could use some sprucing up. We were there while the pool bar was open and I don't know if the staff was new or not but they couldn't seem to get it together. I would however, give this place another chance.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again if it were free!”
Reviews.Author: byebye58
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the dirtiest, most unprofessionally run hotel we've ever stayed in. The floors were filthy, the bathroom moldy. The towels were hard to come by.. not sure whey they were stingy with them as they were old, thin, plain white towels. They made up our room and left NO toilet paper. Parking was the pits. Everyone working there was under the age of 20 so when you wanted to talk to a manager there was never any around. First room they gave us was "overlooking the pool"... It was on the pool level and outside our sliding doors was a bar/grill that was open to the public as well as music until 1am. Demanded to be moved the after the first night and ended up on the 4th floor overlooking the street... very noisy at night. Doors from hotel to street were never locked. Doors into rooms were old, you could hear every movement/noise in the halls. NEVER EVER AGAIN WOULD I STAY AT THIS HOTEL. IT WAS ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING. The only positive was the location.

Reviews.Title: “dirty”
Reviews.Author: kimme97
Reviews.Content: The location of Tidelands is wonderful. However, when we returned from the beach and began to shower, we noticed the shower curtain was covered with mold. I requested a new shower curtain immediately ... received it. We had to ask for toilet tissue while we were there. Tile floors were nice, but seemed like they were never cleaned. Ice machine was broken, but could buy ice for $1 @ front desk. The night before we left, the ice machine was repaired .... but it cost $.75 for a bucket. Hotel charged us for hi-speed internet in our initial room fees ..... never could get the internet to work. Spider webs on lamp shades. Dirty walls. Very disapointed in the cleanliness. Sad when you feel dirty even after a shower. Our family's room next to us hold mold completely around the toilet. mold around the tops of the walls in the room. think i've said enough.

Reviews.Title: “Not The Best”
Reviews.Author: lmb111
Reviews.Content: We had a pool side king suite which was ample room for a family of 5 (3) teenage boys. The problem we had was after day 2 of our stay, the cleaning staff stopped showing up to clean our room. Five out of a seven day stay I had to go down to the front desk to request cleaning service, fresh towels and toilet paper. The front desk personnel and mgr were very apologetic and did have us taken care of right of way. Two of the days we did not get any cleaning services because house keeping stops at 3:30. Later that week I went back to the hotel mgr to let him know how disappointed we were with the services and for the type of money we spent staying at his hotel if he could at least comp us for one day. He said he would follow up with us before we checked out, but ironically he was not available for the remainder of the week. Also, the ice machines are still broken as stated in previous reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Some good and some bad”
Reviews.Author: stangmd
Reviews.Content: Good: We have 3 young children and often find that we have to go to bed early to get them to go to bed when on vacation. The room layout of the 2 room suites was exactly what we needed. When you enter the room you are in a room with a king size bed, dresser and tv, you then walk through the kitchenette area/bathroom area into another room with another king size bed, couch, table chairs, tv and balcony. We were able to put the kids to bed and stay up watching tv, sitting on the balcony as late as we wanted without disturbing their sleep. Another positive was the wait staff by the pool, they were always friendly and accomodating. BAD: I had read about the ice situation and was really dissapointed to see it to be true. I've never stayed at a hotel that charged you for ice, I wasn't about to buy a bag of ice just to have a cold glass of soda. The hotel is also divided into 2 seperate buildings, if you stayed in the building not directly on the boardwalk you had no outside shower or hose to rinse the sand off before going inside unless of course you wanted to climb the stairs to the pool area and rinse off there, not an easy feet with 3 small kids and a bunch of sand toys. Another complaint was the Blue Fin Bar and pool area was open to the public, I understand the bar wanting more business than just the hotel however, since it's open to the pool it meant a lack of pool chairs for the paying hotel guests. Not to mention that the pool was being used by their sister hotel across the street, Too many people too small a pool deck meant you had to get up bright and early for a lounge chair if you weren't going to the pool. The biggest bad thing was the parking, there aren't enough parking spots at the hotel, a few across the street and the remainder a 2 block walk away, which is a realy pain with the kids. Problem is people were allowed to park illegally next to the office and therefore those who were parked legally had a hard time getting in and out of the parking spaces. I understand peoples frustrations with having to walk 2 blocks to their cars but we were all in the same boat and having to shimmy in and out of a parking space to keep from hitting an illegally parked car was a bit frustrating. All in all the hotel was just okay, the staff (other than the pool bar staff) were just okay and not overly accomodating. The location was great if you wanted to be in the mix but I'm not sure I'd stay here again without first trying a few other places. It wouldn't take much to make this a really great hotel, too bad the management doesn't feel the need to make those changes.

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: JMP60
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The rooms were dirty. Housekeeping did not make the beds or drop off linens one day. We had to ask for toilet paper another day. (In all fairness, we noticed things were better on the days that certain people were working.) Parking was very hard to find. "Overflow parking" was a block away in a random lot. The front desk personnel were rude and not very helpful (although the male clerks were much more friendly and helpful). Security was non-existent. Doors leading to the alleyways were propped open all night. The pool closed at 9:00 p.m., but every night people were being loud and music was blaring way after midnight. Took us two days to catch up with the hotel manager. He never seemed to be around. No ice; had to buy it from the front desk. No doors dividing the two sleeping areas; so no privacy. The only thing this place has going for it is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money and go elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: nursefunky
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel several years ago when it first opened and had a good experience. We decided we'd check it out once again because of it's ideal location near the boardwalk, beach, and amusements. What a disappointment!!! When we first got into the room, we went out onto the balcony to check out our view. When we stepped back in to close the sliding glass door, it wouldn't budge. I spoke with two people at the front desk. After the first call, a housekeeper closed it for us and said it needed to be fixed by maintenance. After waiting for a half hour, no one showed up. Second call yielded nothing. Finally, after my husband called the manager, maintenance showed up. That was a joke too. He left to get some "parts" and didn't come back again until my husband called the manager once again to see when this guy was coming back. The manager also said he would do something for us because of all this trouble. One of the most disturbing finds was the mildew in the bathroom. Not small areas but large areas, clumps of mildew in the shower and in the corners of the bathroom near the tub. Totally unacceptable! The entrance we always utilized coming into the hotel was always full of flies. The service was terrible as well. Our room was not ready until after 3PM. Later this summer we are returning to Ocean City but have already made reservations elsewhere. I would rather spend the extra money and stay in a clean room with friendly service. Additionally, the two pools they have are very small and there were never enough chairs for everyone. People were literally tripping over each other. Parking is like all the hotels in that area--tight. Also, the water pressure in our bathroom was terrible. We couldn't even brush our teeth in the bathroom sink. We had to use the sink in our kitchenette area, One day we had to call maintenance again to unclog our tub as the water would not go down. I was ready to come home from this vacation thanks to Tidelands.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: 711heather
Reviews.Content: I was nervous when I read reviews about this hotel. I almost cancelled our trip. I am glad we decided to go. The rooms were clean. The entire staff was kind, said hello whether we were in the elevator, at the pool, in the hall, or at the front desk,and always smiling. The maid service even went the extra mile and after cleaning our room arranged our childrens stuffed animals on their bed, which made them laugh and giggle. We never had a problem with sleeping or noise. We stayed in a room which had a poolview. The location was perfect for our three kids. It was easy and quick to get back to the hotel if they became tired. I will stay there again next year and bring my extended family.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE IT'S DIRTY”
Reviews.Author: kitkka
Reviews.Content: I wish I would have read all your reviews before hand. All the ice macines were broke(quite a coincidence) but you could buy a bag for a 1.00 quote from the desk clerk "The cheapest around". I would not have booked this hotel. When we entered our room it' was dirty. I had to go to the front desk and ask that the sheets be changed there was dirt and black hair on the sheets. The floors were filthy and the floor boards and corners needed a good scrubbing. The wter pressure was awful I had a drizzle for a shower. I have stayed at the Casablanca, Howard Johnsons, Flamingo, Holiday Inn and other hotels along the board walk(I wanted to stay closer) what a mistake. This is terrible that people actually stay here and no one seems to care. Although I will check all reviews before I rent a hotel room again. I'm a nurse and talk about infection control.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Marie1968_40
Reviews.Content: If you want to go to a hotel where the employees sit in a chair and play games while you try to tell them about a problem stay here. I had to buy ice,clean the bath tub, sweap the floor. The hotel is just DIRTY!!!!!!!!!!!!!! JOLYNN I think I got the name right is RUDE and who is the manger because she or he is Never around. I booked the hotel because it's right on the boardwalk I should have read the reviews before I booked the place. They do have BEGBUGS my 3yr old has bed bugs bites and the manger has yet to call me back. I'm calling the health dept on this hotel.......PLEASE DONT GO TO THIS HOTEL BEDBUGS AND THEY DON'T CARE!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “So far so good”
Reviews.Author: Iluvocsun
Reviews.Content: So far my experience has been good. I am not staying there till next week so my opinion might change. I called to ask about my concern about parking since we will be bringing 2 cars. The woman that answered the phone was friendly and helpful. I have been reading and honestly I am freaked out to see how this turns out but so far so good. As far as the price we paid less for a suite than the other motel rooms nearby are going for. I will update when I come back but I must say it was in clear terms if you cancel up to 7 days before you stay you lose 10% of your deposit. 2 years ago we switched a condo for another unit in the same building on bayside and because we did this 1 month before the stay we were told if it was rented we wouldn't Lose our deposit but guess what we didn't get over $400 back because they didn't rent it out. Needless to say losing your deposit can happen anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: andrea19684
Reviews.Content: Rooms had sand on the floor. Kitchen had ants. We were not given toilet paper, had to get it from front desk. Ice machines were broken (so we were told). Front desk wanted to sell us ice for $1. Pools were very small. Parking was difficult to find. The only good thing was the great location!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.......”
Reviews.Author: pepper7070
Reviews.Content: me and my family stayed at the tidelands hotel 4th of july weekend we had all ball. we stayed in a ocean front room on the 3rd floor the housekeeper was ever nice she helped out alot. the only bad thing about my stay was parking we could not find a parking spot no where.

Reviews.Title: “Choose somewhere else to stay!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: trensha
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel stay I have ever experienced. The housekeeping staff needed training on how to properly clean rooms. The floors were not swept daily and we did not receive clean towels (even after leaving the dirty ones in a pile on the bathroom floor). The shower was a mildewy mess and the shower curtain had mold on it. Our room had no table or chairs. The only place to sit was on the beds. It was challenging trying to get my 7 year old to eat his breakfast cereal while sitting on a bed. The deal breaker for me was the fact that they did not have an ice machine. They actually charged us $1.00 for a bag of ice. The front desk staff said that the ice machine was broken. However, I saw the cooler where they got the bagged ice and the setup looked permanent to me. Why not be honest and say that they sell ice to their guests? I've never stayed at a hotel that did not have an ice machine. Clearly customer service is not a priority here. Lying to guests demonstrates that. I know I did not pay to stay at the Waldorf Astoria, but the staff could have been more helpful and courteous when assisting me with a problem with our room. In fact, my problem was not treated with concern or priority. In addition, our rooms keys had to be reset everyday. Imagine getting to your room with a 7 year old that has to go to the bathroom to find that your room key is not working again. What a hassle.!!!!! I would never stay here again or recommend this dump to anyone. I wouldn't let my dog stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Of This Crap Hole”
Reviews.Author: kakell565
Reviews.Content: My family has been on vacation every year for 20 years and this place was a nightmare. We started off in room 325 but the a/c didn't work so they moved us to room 328. We had a 2 room suite and was booked for 5 nights but stayed for 4. We would have relocated to another hotel but we paid for this place in advance and they have a strict NO REFUND POLICY and we couldn't afford to absorb the cost of another hotel. When we returned home from OC I called the OC Health Department to report the overall filthiness of this hotel. I learned that the state of Maryland has no guidelines for cleanliness for hotels. I couldn't believe it. It''s no wonder this hotel is so shoddy and the staff is so rude and unfriendly. We had bedbugs, which the OC Health Department has to check so I happily reported it. There was a horrid smell in the stair well (which was absolutely filthy) and the entire third floor. Save your breath if you want to complain because these people simply don't care, they already have your money and you will not get a refund. The fire alarm went off one night at about 11 p.m. so the whole place had to be evacuated. We received no discount or explanation from the staff and the manager was very scarce and spent most of his time hiding from all of the complaining guests. This place blows.

Reviews.Title: “Never AGAIN>>>>>”
Reviews.Author: krose123
Reviews.Content: I would not recamend this DISGUSTING hotel to anyone. The staff was rude as well as the housekeeping staff didn't even sweep out our room daily when they sopposely cleaned. We had sand that built up because they have tile floors. They get wet and get very slippery. The staff at the front counter was rude when asked for directions for a local resturaunt. Thier hallways smell disgusting like fresh vomit. I woud l never stay here again with my children. There was parting going on all through the night in the hallways with people banging on doors. Trust me save your money and go some where with a 5star rating. They have no rating here!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Oh no, what happened!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia T
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Tidelands on and off for at least 10 years, probably more. We have always enjoyed our stay. The rooms were always kept clean, perfect location. We loved sitting on the balcony listening to the Ocean and watching the people on the boardwalk. The hotel had also told us that they had completely remodeled. First nightmare, two weeks before we arrived a Hooters Restaurant opened right next door. The noise was unbelievable, even after they closed people moved outside and partied right in front of the place AND our hotel. Second, about the remodeling, hmmmm they should get their money back for the LITTLE that was done. The got new cabinets and "granite" counter tops, no way were the real granite. The furniture is just as I remembered it, may have been new comforters although mine had cigarette burns all through it. They also claimed to have re tiled the bathroom, once again if they did they need to get their money back, the tiles did not meet up very well and they didn't look any different than before, maybe they just replaced some bad ones. Things that were MOST difficult for me, other than no sleep, the drawer that they put in the kitchen area was not big enough to fit the silverware tray (??) so they laid it on the bottom of the cupboard under the sink, I have had recent surgery and can't bend so there was no way for me to get to these, an unexpected problem. Next they had safes installed in the rooms, nice idea, but once again putting them near the floor is not very accessible got me and I am sure many others. We have always recommended this hotel to all our family and friends but unless Hooters finds another home I would not recommend to this place to anyone but teenagers that want to party all night! Believe me, there were plenty. The front desk was very friendly and I realize there is nothing they can do about the problems that I encountered. I hope the management reads this and perhaps a couple of hotels could get together and get Hooters away from what used to be a relatively quiet area. So convenient to everything. I am deeply saddened by my visit this time.

Reviews.Title: “we loved our tidelands caribbean hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: suzie046
Reviews.Content: my friend and i stayed at the tidelands caribbean hotel for a long weekend this past september. when we arrived, the staff was very pleasant upon checking in. we asked about eating at seafood restaurants, and they were quick to come up with a few names of nearby restaurants that offered seafood and other types of food. we also asked about shopping. they told us about the outlet shops located just 2 miles away, over the route 50 bridge. our room was beautiful. we booked a 2 room suite with a jacuzzi tub. our balcony overlooked the pool, and we were told that many of the rooms at the tidelands had view of the ocean as well. we had beautiful weather and enjoyed the beach, which is right in front of the hotel! you don,t have the cross any streets. being that it is on the boardwalk, we strolled at night and took advantage of all the boardwalk attractions. my friend plays golf, and that was just a few minutes by car from the tidelands caribbean hotel. we were so happy here, especially listening to live music by the pool at the bluefin bar and grill. we highly recommend it to everyone and will definitely come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “bad, bad, bad”
Reviews.Author: luvthebeach35
Reviews.Content: Our first problem was we had reserved a handicapped accessible, ocean front room. When we got there, it was a side ocean view. I went to the front desk and was told that no one would have ever told me that because they don't have ocean front handicap rooms. Even though I had a confirmation stating ocean front handicap they said I was wrong. The ocean front room was already checked into by our party. We had two ocean front rooms, one of which was handicap accessible. I was not happy. Then, when we went into the room, we discovered that their definition of handicap rooms does not meed ADA standards. The walk in shower had a lip that was at least 2" high. ADA standards are no more than 1/2". The toilet was a regular toilet with a grab bar installed. It was not higher as code says. We could not get the lift under the bed, the hallway to the bathroom was very small. The rooms were not clean, our refrigerator leaked, I could go on and on. There were 15 people in our group and each had at least one complaint about their individual room.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Letgo7
Reviews.Content: My family and I just came back from Tidelands and we would not stay again. It was, by far, the noisiest hotel I have EVER stayed in my whole life. We booked a Bay view king suite for $189 per night. I read on Trip Advisor and on the Tidelands website that the hotel has been renovated. WARNING...not all rooms have been renovated. Our room was clean but our biggest problem was the street noise and the two rooms above us full of wasted teenagers. We were traveling with a three year old and our first night we did not get to sleep until 2 a.m. We called the front desk to complain twice and nothing was done at all. The next morning I complained to Paul the manager who assured me that he would handle the situation. That night we didn't hear a peep out of the two rooms above. Why does it take talking to a manager to get this resolved??? We have family who stayed in a pool view suite and they had a huge hole in their mattress! We were told that our rooms had been renovated and our family has holes in their mattress and we had broken furniture. We could not find an ice machine in the entire hotel that worked and the bar makes the worst drink I have ever had in my life. If you like to party (really hard), stay up drinking all night and scream off of balconies, this is the place for you. Party on Dude!

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkNeeron
Reviews.Content: Air conditioning did not work so we were moved to another room. That room had mildew on ceiling and in bathroom. When we asked to check out early we were told that we would not get a refund. Front desk customer service and hotel "management" are impossible to deal with. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Hilton, but could have been worse. Good location”
Reviews.Author: beachllvr
Reviews.Content: Ok, it wasn't our first choice or even our 4th, but we had a great time with no housekeeping issues or snotty desk clerks. We had a2 room king suite overlooking bay. It was large, clean, immaculate kitchen area, perfect a/c, plenty of towels and little bath products. I hesitated booking here because of previous reviews, but the other places were unavailable. We had 2 tvs, 2 mini fridges, very clean kitchen and private balcony. The beds were ok, but they need to upgrade the linens. The sheets are threadbare and there are no blankets, which I thought was weird, just a bedspread. You did have to pay for ice, but $3 so what. Sliding glass door is heavy and you need to push hard. We were in the building behind the oceanfront, 5th floor. Pool is small, but I didn't really notice many places with great big pools. Pool bar was okay, ate there once, just ok. In room safe was very handy. Location is great, steps from beach and boardwalk. Parking wasn't an issue for us, got a space under the hotel first day. Just left car there and made use of the great bus service. Stop is outside hotel. $2 pp a day, you can ride bus anywhere it goes. Used it rest of stay,never moved car. Cost us $25 for 4 people to ride boardwalk tram up and back. Did it once, then use the air conditioned bus when we were too hot or tired to walk. Only issue was bathtub, a piece of the deep jacuzzi tub kept falling off. we just kept pushing it back in. We are used to better hotels so my expectations weren't that high. Not the Hilton, but not terrible. Though, when I was at front desk, people were checking out and complaining that no one ever came to fix the refrigerator in their room the entire stay, they didn't seem too happy. Front desk people don't seem to know much about the tourist attractions in the area. It still wouldn't be my first choice of hotels, but we could have stayed in a much worse place. Have a feeling rooms are very hit and miss, you won't know what you get until you are there. We lucked out. Oh yeah, the hallways have a funky smell. Elevators were average size and never had to wait for one. We are picky Long Islanders and we managed to have a good time there.

Reviews.Title: “tidelands definatley one of the better stays in ocean city, md.”
Reviews.Author: asd14_2000
Reviews.Content: Our stay with Tidelands was truly wonderful. We have had a good experience 3 years in a row with them. We have 3 children and the convienence of the hotel is awesome. they are right on the boardwalk, and have a little store nearby. We tried to stay at harrison hall and left as soon as we walked in, what a dump. Paul and the staff at tidelands took us in at the last minute this year and made our stay a truly wondeful experience as usual. We will never stay anywhere but here in oc again. thanks again paul and the staff, you deserve a raise and definately have our respect. god bless. Sincerly, The shaulis family Friedens, Pa

Reviews.Title: “A Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: PhilJDamascus_MD_USA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two room suite, which was good for 2 adults, 2 kids. Nice to be able to watch what we wanted on tv, and fall asleep at different times. Tidelands was in a good spot for getting to beach and boardwalk. Coffee and doughnuts were close by, and plenty of other boardwalk eats nearby. We went flounder fishing one day, and getting across the 50 bridge was only a five minute ride to the marinas. Didn't go to the busy pool/grille, although it was right past our balcony. The rooftop pool was nice and and quiet. It just depends on what you are looking for. There were some minor things, like sliding door hard to open/close and lots of AC condensation on floor. To me, these are not tripbreaking problems, just some things you need to adjust to. Some people seem to get all bent out of shape over the little stuff, which is an invitation to disappointment. This is not a five star place, and you should not expect unrealistic things. I had absolutely no issues with staff here, unlike some reviewers. You get what you pay for. I stayed one night at another property (450/night), and yes, it was newer and better. I think Tidelands is a good value for downton OC.

Reviews.Title: “Tidelands has anyone stayed”
Reviews.Author: richierich64
Reviews.Content: Has anyone stayed here. We are looking for October and want to make sure it's a clean place with decent accomadations

Reviews.Title: “Run down”
Reviews.Author: Audioi
Reviews.Content: Main door could not be opened by a child as were many rooms we went in and out of. Sliding door took a trained adult to open. Room & towels reeked of smoke. One bed sagged in the middle due to broken box spring. Mold in room corners. Black mold dripping from AC register on 5th floor. Upper pool gate broken entirely. Most of the parking is two blocks away. None of the front desk employees would smile if they had to especially Mrs Frown. 2 out of four bathroom lamps were out for our entire stay. Had to purchase Ice. Only one elevator for all rooms. Overall it was Disgusting and a run down establishment. It appears that they get your money and do not care about anything else. Wireless access worked 20% of the time but it is included. But it was close to the boardwalk and a really cool Kite Store called The Kite Loft.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: crabcrew
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a stay at the Tideland Suites and Hotel. We were not in the oceanfront building but the building behind with a 2 king suite with a sideview. I was a little nervous after reading other reviews after I booked my reservations, however the hotel we stayed at had non of those problems. The room was clean, kitchenette was clean, pool was alittle small but still very nice. Bluefin bar & grill was great our kids could swim and we could have a frosty drink in the evenings after returning from the boardwalk. We did have sand on the floor in our room but we were at the beach where they normally have sand and kids tend to drag sand in with them on there feet and toys. House keeping did sweep because i caught them 1 day but the beach is the beach. They do ask that you rinse off sand before entering the lobby however we could not find a foot washing station anywhere around our building they did have a hose on the second floor by the pool that you could use. Great hotel we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest Hotel I've Stayed in OC”
Reviews.Author: fdbgraphix
Reviews.Content: We heard this hotel was recently renovated and under new management, so we decided to check it out for our week long vacation with our family. The hotel was beautiful and the rooms were clean and elegant. Our balcony over the boardwalk was wonderful for sipping wine after the kids were in bed, and luckily the air conditioning worked great because boy was it hot outside. Apparently they recently added a new parking lot, because there was plenty of parking even though the hotel was full. There were two pools, which kept our kids happy, and a pool bar, which kept us happy. The internet access in the rooms was speedy and very convenient, as we stayed in another hotel last year that did not offer internet access. We called downstairs at one point to get some extra towels and they brought them within fifteen minutes. I also have to commend the manager, the room next door to us got a little loud so we called the front desk to see what could be done, and it was handled promptly and effectively and we never had another problem. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, we might be coming back in august without the kids and we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Going Back next July and staying in this hotel again!”
Reviews.Author: 0709VACATION
Reviews.Content: We had never been to OC before and booked this hotel before we read the reviews. Needless to say, I was a nervous wreck after reading them but the reviews were wrong. The place was clean. Our room was clean. This place isn't the Hilton but it was great for our vacation. The location is GREAT and the staff is FANTASTIC!!! I would reccommend this hotel to anyone. I don't know where these other people stayed but it couldn't have been the Tideland on the boardwalk. We had no mold, the elevator worked fine, the pools were clean, everyone was friendly and very helpful. We even tried to book our trip for next July when we checked out but can't that far in advance. Needless to say in Jan. we will once again be booking our OC Vacation and we will be staying at the Tideland Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled before we made a big mistake!”
Reviews.Author: getaway45
Reviews.Content: We found the Tidelands Carribbean online after hours and hours of looking for something on the boardwalk so our teens would have lots to do. In all the back and forth looking and comparing, I forgot to check some reviews until AFTER I booked 3 nights in August. Then, after reading such horrible reviews, including bedbug issues, mold, and general odor and filth, I tried not to panic and decided to call and find out what had been done about these issues. I was told I'd have to talk to the manager, and they would leave a message for him to call me since he leaves everyday around 5, not back in until 9 am the next day. (No manager on duty any evening, another red flag) I also sent an email asking for a call addressing my concerns. No return email or return phone call after 3 days! I finally called back and asked for the manager. The clerk on the phone was rude and interupted me several times. "Look, I can't do anything but take your name and number and give him the message." was her response. I of course mentioned that I had already done that and no one returned my call. She then said "Do you want to leave a message or not!" I said "Excuse me? is that really how you talk to your customers!?!?" I asked for her name and she hung up on me. If this is their customer service before you even arrive, I thought I'd better take all those bad reviews seriously. I called back two hours later and cancelled my reservation. We are now staying one day less for $100 more a night at the Holiday Inn & Suites on 17th/Boardwalk . . . of course I made sure I read the reviews FIRST.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on boardwalk nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lester04
Reviews.Content: We stayed Monday-Thursday and had a good time with no problems. I was a little scared after reading some of the reviews about the hotel but we had a great time. The water pressure stinks but most places I've stayed have crappy water pressure. We stayed in the two room suite w/2 kings beds, pull out sofa sleeper and kitchenette. It was my husband and me, my 20 yr. old daughter and her boyfriend and two 15 yr. old boys. Having a safe in the room was great for locking up things before you left the room. Beds were comfortable and we had fitted sheets unlike what was described in an earlier review. Pools are small but nice. They were always busy while we were there. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice environment”
Reviews.Author: chronichild
Reviews.Content: the hotel is nice the parking wasnt to good very small spaces but you gotta use what you have to run a business.my stay was pleasant my room was on the fifth floor my housekeeper was very pleasant and helpful.i would suggest better front desk clerks the girl at the front desk didnt tell me i had to reset my key.then i tried to unlock my door and still didnt get in once again the housekeeper had to let me in thanks to her or i wouldve had to wait for the 20min elevator again. but overall i enjoyed my stay.not as bad as some old reviews.

Reviews.Title: “The best weekend every year!”
Reviews.Author: hrshygrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tidelands for the 2nd year this past weekend and it was everything we knew from last year and then some! We were again celebrating our anniversary and we had a blast! The price is not bad, the location is perfect - not too far from anything you want to do, the pool on the roof is the best spot for sun and seclusion, the rooms are very spacious and clean, and the balconies are great for just enjoying a nice breeze with your morning coffee. There's easy access to everything from the ocean, boardwalk, bars, restaurants and the strip and the staff is very helpful and courteous. This was our 3rd year in OC for our anniversary getaway and only our 2nd stay at the Tidelands, but certainly not our last. See ya next year!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back!”
Reviews.Author: tripletsplus1mom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tidelands with my four children and my sister and her daughter stayed in another room. Neither of our rooms was ready by check-in. Bathroom by roof top pool was filthy, toilet not working, no trash can. Pool area was filthy, again no trash can so trash was everywhere. Both pools very small. One king bed was completely lopsided and box spring had to be replaced. No bedding for pull out. Had to call three times and took 3 hours to receive with tired children waiting. Many rooms in seperate buildings which are not on boardwalk actually at least half block from ocean. Might as well pay less for not boardwalk location. No broom in room walked on sandy cold tile floor for two days. Halls smelled of mildew due to previous flooding. Outside walking to pool area smelled of trash due to trash cans lining the path. Finally, my car was keyed up and down both sides 20 minutes after arrival. I informed front desk who could have cared less.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, old.”
Reviews.Author: TennisRF
Reviews.Content: So, I usually go with my friends to Ocean City once a year and this year we picked a bad hotel -- Tidelands. First off, the hallways reeked of something terrible, can't really describe the smell -- maybe a mix of paint and trash? The bathroom was pretty gross -- there was rust or something dark on the bottom of the bath tub that couldn't be washed away (very unsightly) and it was clearly an old bathroom with some weird dried glue stuff or something on the edges of the sink. The bed covers were also stained, which was not comforting. Pillows were all different, some lumpy, some fatter, some flatter, not very nice pillows. Internet was super slow. The housekeeping decided not to clean our room the 2nd day because one person was in there when they arrived and instead they dropped off 3 towels (it was a 4-person room). With all the sand from the beach and dirty towels, it would have been really nice to have the place cleaned! On top of that, there wasn't enough parking one evening and we had to search for parking on the street. Oh, and there was a fire alarm one of the mornings at around 7:30 AM so we had to evacuate. We stayed 3 nights and were quite glad to leave. In short, this was NOT a pleasant place to stay. The only good thing about it is the location. We've stayed at other hotels in Ocean City before and they were not this old and dirty, so try another place instead.

Reviews.Title: “Noooooooo, keep looking!”
Reviews.Author: gehpa
Reviews.Content: Parking is a hassle, there is one elevator for 5 floors. You have to wait for the elevator just a few feet away from the front desk, where the space narrows down for one person to be able to pass to this space that is big enough for 3 or 4 people to wait. If you are checking in/out and you have your bags, coolers and groceries - good luck. It is a tight fit. The ice machine was broken, but if it was working, bring money because you have to pay for ice. "Lucky" for us - they were selling bags of ice for $3, the same size you can get at the grocery store for $1,79. We had to ask for sheets for the pull out bed twice, once around 4:00p (so we would have them at bed time later) and again around 9:00p. When the sheets were finally delivered, they were shoved in my face and the boy delivering them left quickly, no hello, no smile, no eye contact. He was obviously annoyed to have to deliver sheets. When we went to bed, both king beds had sand in the sheets. I have been going to OC MD for almost 20 years, I'm not sure how you get sand in clean unused sheets. The morning of check out there were signs in the elevator advising guests of extended checkout rates. We were going to the beach before leaving for home so we thought extended checkout was a good idea. When we asked about it, we were told our room didn'ty apply for extended checkout. That makes no sense - do you want the extra $45 dollars or not? So we went back to our room at 10:45am to gather our things to be out by 11:00am. Only the keys didn't work anymore because they are programmed to expire at check out, which is fine, but it wasn't 11:00a yet. So I went back to the desk to have the key reprogrammed. The grumpy girl at the desk reprogrammed the key, but as I said, her personality has much to be desired. Which is something I don't need when I am paying $269 a night. How about a smile? How about not acting like you are doing me a favor? How about opening your mouth and speaking a lilttle louder? I don't know her name but she is the brunette with the long bob. Definatly not a friendly person. I wouldn't stay here again and I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone, not worth the money paid..

Reviews.Title: “Not like the reviews state - take the chance to see for yourself!”
Reviews.Author: Jenstays
Reviews.Content: When my friends had booked this hotel for my rather large bachelorette party I was psyched because they sent me the link which made everything look great. However, I was terrified after researching it and reading the previous reviews. I took a chance because it was too late to reschedule our trip and found it to be good for the amount of money we spent. We booked the 2 bedroom suites. The location was fabulous! The rooms were just fine & there weren't any complaints from the group besides the parking situation. There was free parking relatively close to the hotel though. Our room was directly down the hall from our room. It was a little chilly, but there was live music on it's deck so we hung out there for a few hours. Most of the girls in our group ate lunch there and complemented the taste! It is not the Adam's Mark or Hyatt of Ocean City, but it is a nice place to go for a week of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: MMCPET
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the last several years. Each year my experience got worse. This year was the absolute worst! We've always had problems with the cleanliness of the room- mold in the bathroom, dirty floors, broken furniture. This year we actually had bugs in our bed! We asked to be moved to a different room which they did at 11pm at night and were told we'd be compensated for the trouble. We were surprised to find that the room we vacated was occupied the next day without ever being fumigated- ewww! When we checked out we mentioned the situation and the only compensation we received was a late checkout. A 5pm checkout on a Sunday in October is not compensation. I even emailed them after we returned to let them know about the problems and to make some suggestions for improving their establishment. They never even emailed me back. Very poor customer service and very poor hotel. We will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry times”
Reviews.Author: dancingbare1383
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Thursday and the elevator was out. I am currently recovering from a fractured bone in my left leg. I had to hoof up three sets of stairs to get to my room. When I checked in, I was told that it would be repaired in one to two hours. It was finally repaired at 10 p.m. This did not finish off the problems with the elevator. All day Friday it was making horrible noises and the door took forever to close. I told the desk staff, several time but they didn't seem to comcerned. Later that night it stopped working again, so up three flights of steps. Saturday morning it was still out of order and was finally fixed at about 10 a.m. This was not the only problem we had.
