Several of the light bulbs in the lamps were out, the coffee pot for the coffee maker was missing and the radio/clock did not work.These things should be checked daily. Also, the towels were horrible. Dingy white, old, worn out. It was horrible. We have stayed there numerour times, but this was by far the worse ever.

Reviews.Title: “Warning - Bedbugs At The Tidelands”
Reviews.Author: mickiecat
Reviews.Content: At a recent stay at the Tideland Caribbean Hotel in Ocean City, MD. I was awoken in the middle of the night to find bedbugs crawling all over the bed and myself. There were more than 50 bedbugs on the bed. It was a major infestation. I immediately called the front desk to complain and ask to be moved to a different room. I was told they would have to contact management before they could do that. After about a half an hour, we were moved to a room in a different building, this was at 4 am in the morning. The next day, no one ever called to apologize for our inconvience or the fact that I had experienced one of the most horrifying moments in my life. When we checked out we spoke to the manager to complain about our ruined vacation. They refused to credit any of our money back. After considerable discussion and after saying we would never stay in that hotel again, the manager did give us a voucher for a free two night stay. We had to pack all our luggage in plastic bags and disinfect everything before bringing into our home. I need a vacation to recover from that vacation. I understand these things happen occasionally but it was the total lack of compassion from the hotel manager that made the situation even worse.

Reviews.Title: “I would give this hotel a F+/G- rating”
Reviews.Author: Nittfan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located only a few steps from the boardwalk. Actually they have 3 buildings; one is OF and the other 2 are directly behind them. Two pools in the rear buildings; one on the roof of the one building (5t floor?) and one on the 2nd floor of the other. We stayed in the "off season" and were lured by a stay 2 weekdday nights and get the 3rd free offer. I will say that given the nasty reviews I would not have considered staying here if not for the decent price and 3rd night free and the proximity to the boardwalk. The room we had was a 2 bedroom suite (NOT private rooms, just so you know; the suites do have 2 bedrooms but you walk from one into another without a door. Not an issue with our party and we WERE informed of this). This property on our stay was just fine for a reasonably priced, very well located property. It was fairly clean, and I did NOT notice any "slime" or "mold" as mentioned by some previous posters. The beds were quite comfy (and I am a fussy, fidgety sleeper) and there was minimal noise, but the hotel was not very full as it was the beginning of the week in Sept. This 2 room suite had a view of the ocean and it was a decent sized balcony where the 3 of us could easily sit and yes it did have a fairly nice OV. The front desk people were nice and pleasant. My only issue with this hotel is that the floors are indeed SLIPPERY when wet and my 62 year old sister FELL in the bathroom a 4a.m. ......... she slipped on a wet spot. There have been previous posters remark about the floor; either that it is "gross or grundgy" or "very slippery". I can attest by our personal experience that the floors are a slippery tile. Easier to maintain and clean when you are a beachfront location and lots of messy people may be dragging in sand and slop, but also more than coincidence if several posters, including my sister, said they fell. I believe the Tidelands is a pretty decent hotel to stay in for the location and the price but they are taking a BIG chance at litigation with the slippery floors and records on here of falls.

Reviews.Title: “Mold Filled Rooms And Blood Sheets!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ocvacationer
Reviews.Content: The website for this hotel is a HUGE LIE!!! This place was filthy dirty and smelled awful! The ceiling in the room we stayed in had mold all over it! The furniture was filled with dust and the floor was so dirty I don't think they have swept it all summer! The sheets had blood on them. Not just one sheet but all of them! We called the front desk to ask for clean ones and the person at the front was so rude. He said someone will be up soon and hung up on me. It took them 30 minutes or more to come up and then they knocked at the door and left the sheets in front of the door. The bathroom was gross also. The tiles were dirty and there was still hair in our shower! The elevator didn't work either. If it wasn't for the storm we would have stayed somewhere else! The fire alarm or some other alarm kept going off at 5 o'clock in the morning!!! The beds were extremely uncomfortable and not a king size as we were promised. The towels and washcloths were gross as well. When we left the room, we hung the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door and housekeeping totally ignored it. They came in our room anyway. Thank god I didn't have anything of any value with me because the people there cannot be trusted! The pool was gross and the food at the "pool bar" was terrible! The waitress, or at least I think she was supposed to be one, didn't speak English very well and was also very rude. When she brought the check to us, we weren't even ready for it, she said "You need to pay now because I am leaving for the day and I want to close your check." I can't believe this place is even still open. I will be contacting the Health Department regarding the unsanitary conditions of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Stay anywhere BUT THE TIDELANDS!!!”
Reviews.Author: OCTRAVEL911
Reviews.Content: Contrary to the inviting pictures on their website - this hotel should have its license revoked. Dirty - blood stained sheets, bed mites, black mold on ceilings, rude staff. Is it any wonder they have a no refund policy? Run - don't walk away from this place AS FAST AS YOU CAN! After one very uncomfortable night, sleeping in our clothes due to the filth, I'm headed to the Hilton even though I paid for 3 nights at the Tidelands. It'll still be cheaper than my doctor bills would be for treating whatever disease my wife & I pick up from this dump. Ugh!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best and not the worst.”
Reviews.Author: lala_k
Reviews.Content: Well, this hotel came as a recommendation from a family memeber who was used to staying at the main building on the Boardwalk. I was not informed when booking the two bedroom suite that it was on Baltimore Ave. I was told pool view and partial ocean view, which it did have. We were not happy about the longer walk to the Boardwalk and beach, since I had my elderly mother with me who just went through a major cancer surgery and was unable to walk far distances. That is why I chose to stay at the Tidelands in the first place....big surprise when we were put in the other building on the 5th floor. No I can only vouch for my stay, but I did take pictures and you can judge for yourself. The room was DIRTY!!!!! It looked like it was not dusted in weeks prior to our arrival, the floors were a flithy mess and we found clothes and candy in the drawers. Not a big deal. When we told the staff down stairs they immediately contacted the head of housekeeping. The next day our refridgerator stopped working. We called down again. The head of housekeeping was up within a 1/2 hour to address the refridgerator issue as well as the other issues. She was called at home the night before. She was very dissappointed and promised to fix the situation completely. We had a new refridgerator delivered and she was to tell our housekeeper about the problems and they should be fixed. The floor was then cleaned. But even though Norma, the head of housekeeping, was to speak with her staff on that floor, her staff obviously did not listen. We never got the extra towels promised, the floor of the room was never cleaned, the bathroom mirror was never cleaned, one day I had the same dirty kitchen towels left. By day 4 we were so completely disgusted we couldn't wait to get out of there. You could not walk on the floor with out shoes or your feet or socks would get completely dirty. Oh, I forgot, the toaster made the smoke alarms go off.....and my husband had to remove them from the walls to get them to stop. No one ever checked out this situation either. Yes, it was no big deal, but if it was, no one seemed to be aware of it. Also the air conditioner from the hall leaked water on the floor in front of our door and made a big mess when you would walk in it(not knowing it was there)and drag that into the room. I have included pictures of where the refridgerator was dragged in the room on Sunday and the floor was never cleaned....we left Wed. and I took these pictures. The pictures are of the corner of the floor, the black mold on the ac, some brown stain on the bottom bed sheet, also not properly put on the bed, crumbs on the floor from Sunday, and marks from the refridgerator being dragged in and never clean. The staff down stairs were nice and tried to be helpful, but I can only speak for the people I dealt with on that day, and the staff changed daily. Will we be staying there again? NO. For the price we paid I would expect more. Oh, and yes, I agree with others that the parking situation was terrible. Walking 2 plus blocks with some one with a cane, is NOT an option. We were just fortunate enough to find some thing under our building.

Reviews.Title: “Wewill not be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: delagirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the worse. They state on their website advertisement on how good it is to stay there, but it was all fake. Firest off, their rooms are dirty and their beds don't have fitted sheets. We discovered bed mites in both beds, complained about it, asked for a different room with no availability, they never got back to us. The air-conditioner was not working, and when they finally send someone to fix it, it was a day before we were leaving. They provided 1 roll of toilet paper, and sometimes did not come clean the room until 4p.m. The staff was very rude and acted like you were bothering them when you asked a question and their was no coffee, but a coffee maker was in the room. We want to contact the better business bureau, mostly because of the bed mites that were in the bed, this is very unhealthy and because of this, and them not correcting the problem when we complained, we slept at a friends house the remaining time, only coming back to the room to get a change of clothes. We should be repremended and have our money returned to us ...

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly as awful as the below reviews make it sound!”
Reviews.Author: TRtravels84
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that this was my family's 3rd stay at the Tidelands Hotel. Both times prior to our last 6 night/ 7 day stay have been enjoyable and our trip the first week of August was no exception. Needless to say, all of the negative reviews on here had us very concerned prior to our arrival bit I am happy to report that the hotel is just as nice as it has been in the past. We did have a couple of glitches that will prevent me from awarding 5 stars however, the issues we're taken care of nearly immediately and had no lasting effect on our vacation. Myself, my fiance, my mom, and my dad all stayed in a 2 bedroom suite, 5th floor. When we first arrived, my mom called down for extra pillows and they we're delivered within 10 minutes of the request... Same can be said for the extra towels we requested. We loaded up our fridge with our sodas and beers around 5 pm and upon our return to the room around 10, we realized that the fridge was not cold. We called down to the front desk and a maintence person came up and informed us that it was froze up and that housekeeping would be able to defrost it in the am. Slightly a pain, but certainly not a huge deal. House keeping did indeed fix the fridge and it ran perfectly for the rest of the week. The next evening we returned to our room and we noticed that our AC unit wasn't nearly as cold as it should have been. I made another call to the desk and a friendly maintence man was at our door within minutes. He also informed us that our AC was frozen up (see a trend? Haha!) and would be back to fix it... Not even 5 minutes later, he was back with new AC filter in hand and all was up and running within 5 more minutes. Beyond those issues, our suite was a spacious room that comfortably housed 4 adults for the week. Being on the 5th floor gave us a great view of both the ocean and bay too! Our only gripes in regards to the room is that the first bedroom (closest to the hallway) has a.) paper thin walls (we think there was a luggage cart derby in the hall!) and b.) that there should be another dresser in the room. The pool bar serves some yummy drinks but during our time there this past week, the kitchen unexpectadly closed due to health department issues. We believe that it had something to do with the fridge and grill not being up to code but the only explanation we received for the shut down and then subsequent limited menu was a "kitchen revamp". Some reviews on here have mentioned that the tile floors are a pain... I feel the opposite. I like that there are no grimey carpets to have sand lodged in. The tile does get slippery when wet and you will end up with some pebbles on your feet if you walk barefoot. My quick solution... Bring slippers. Problem solved. In regards to parking... It's a crapshoot. Either you are lucky enough to score a parking spot in one of the main lots, or you have to hoof it a couple of blocks to the over flow lot. Not a huge deal in our eyes because we parked our car and then use the bus system to get to places off the boards or use the tram for places on the boards. I know this is a long review but with all the negativity on here about TCH, I figured a positive review would help. One thing to remember, you are in a beach community and for the location, Tidelands is a decent bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience Ever!!! Dont Stay there”
Reviews.Author: rstair36
Reviews.Content: This was the worst experience I have ever had at a hotel in my life. I could mentions many many many little things such as dirty rooms, dirty linens, broken beer bottle behind the night stand. But none of these complaints comes close to how our trip ended. On our last morning we had the door open on us by the next tenant who was going to be staying in our room!!! We had not even checked out , it was before 11am and the next person had already been giving a key to our room. The lady was extremely rude and said, "oh we just wanted to put our bags on the floor until you check out"!!!! We werent allowed to check in until 3pm. I would never in a million years recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place”
Reviews.Author: mech_8
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay with my wife and 2 small children and had a good time. Not as bad as reviews indicate. Clean large room with small kitchen. Bathtub in bathroom needs replaced and beds need to have fitted sheets. Hotel staff was nice and all spoke english .Parking is not perfect but not as bad as some say.Location is very good on boardwalk. I have been going to ocean city for many years and have stayed at alot worse places then this for the same money

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: tlc1100
Reviews.Content: This place looks so great on the internet! It's Not! The room was disgusting. The ceiling was covered in black mold and I wouldn't even let my 5 year old take a shower, it was so gross! The bed frame was beautful but the bed was no thicker than a piece of foam and our beach towels made better pillows. The sheets were dirty, the elevator broke several times when we were there, there was no parking, the staff was rude and the pools were the size of bath tubs. I was so disappointed! We spent a lot of money on this vacation thinking that it would be worth it, we were wrong!

Reviews.Title: “It wasn't that bad....”
Reviews.Author: zander20
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay at the Tidelands BEFORE reading the horrific reviews. I walked into the place with a chip on my shoulder, expecting the worst. Our room was clean, but did show some minor wear & tear and the staff was very nice. We ran into the famous parking problem, if you leave at night you won't have a spot when you get back. No big deal, their overflow lot was less than a minute walk away. Would I have wanted to stay here for a week? No, especially with no laundry facilites and two teenagers who change clothes every three hours. The location was great for the kids, they could go to the boardwalk whenever they wanted. We got a weekday rate of $199/night for the two king suite which was alot less than many hotels 40-50+ streets up. It was perfect for a 3 day last minute trip.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: brucePA
Reviews.Content: Positives 1. Close to the amusements 2. Room ready early 3. Resonably priced 4. Outside pool bar 5. Nice rooms for the price Negatives 1. Not enough parking 2. Cars in lot without parking permits 3. Sand in bed sheets 4. Worn down sofa bed 5. Maid service never gave us enough towels, toilet paper I probably would go back because it is a good value considering the location. I really don't need a 5 star hotel because I usually don't plan on spending much time in the room. If you find a parking spot, try not to move your car. Shake out your bed sheets. Tolerate the broken down sofa bed. Harass the front desk if you don't have enough amenities. The management will never change and why should they change? They offer a prime location at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go there ever again!”
Reviews.Author: DreamOnMaryland
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked very appealing on the internet and their write-up looked very good. We go to OC every year and normally stay at The Holiday Inn & Suites - 17th street (wonderful, above average hotel), but decided to try somewhere different. This hotel is located on 5th street - absolutely NO PARKING. We stayed in a suite because we had many people staying; needless to say we had two cars. Their policy is one parking permit per room. Okay I understand that but we couldn't even find parking for one car, and my car was across the highway down a side street after an HOUR - (no exaggeration) of driving around. This made us decide to stay in the immediate area and not use our cars to go anywhere in the area, which was confining. So the last night we decided to go for dinner farther away and upon returning again we ran into the same problem - no parking. This time our first car found a spot at the hotel right away and I eventually came to the hotel after about 45 minutes of driving around looking for a spot. I found one at the hotel and asked the hotel staff if I could possibly stay there, it was our last night, could I please just stay there I had been riding around for quite a while. They said "no" their policy was one permit per room. I told them that the Holiday Inn and Suites on 17th street had the same policy and out of good customer service they gave us a second permit. They said "well their manager must have approved it". They weren't very helpful or concerned in any way and they had vacancies - so it's not like every room had a permit. On another note, for a suite that eight people would be staying in there were four towels (no hand or face towels) and no sheets for the pull-out sofa bed. Room was clean. Did not like tile floors - I read that in a review before we went and didn't really pay attention to it, but with sand and wet feet it can be dangerous as well as not very "comfy" I guess. Also for a suite with that many people there was one bathroom. Sometimes there's an additional vanity area outside the bathroom - not so here, so if you have many adults going plan accordingly to get your turns in the bathroom. So, in general I would give this hotel 2 out of 5 stars and if I may recommend the Holiday Inn and Suites on 17th street (5 stars +). Hope this is helpful in someway to someone.

Reviews.Title: “very rude hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: milah202
Reviews.Content: first of all upon checking in I stood there for aleast 10 min. because frnt. desk took a phone call during me checking in and the other one(staff) typed on her cell phone, I asked what time the pool closed and was told 11pm, I reserved 2 rooms,we checked in went swimming and next thing you know one of the hotel employees came to the pool area whistled loudly and told everyone to get out the pool because it was closed I ask him why, he told me because it is, I explained to him that the front desk said it closed at 11pm and I will speak to the front desk he screamed in my face while I was holding my infant I am the front desk, I proceeded to the front desk were I checked in and she told me that I need to make a complaint to the man. because they have had several compliaints about this staff speaking to customers so rudely, proceedeing back to the pool area where now a full arguement was taking place between drunken staff and druken guest and my family, after everything my entire family was kicked out of the hotel after only being there for 11/2 hr. the staff said they had a problem with one of the guest but kicked all 3 rooms out, with no refund saying they felt threatened, in my room was myself my husband who is paralyzed in a wheelchair and my 1yearold twin infants(threat really), no money was refunded, nothing in black and white stating that we violated anyone to be kicked out, no contracts avail. no rules posted, no policies posted, nothing, a complete rip off, I am taking legal action, I am also filing a civil complaint.

Reviews.Title: “READ fine print, Doubled my rate for 1 more night stay”
Reviews.Author: ebsaville
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 nights originally, asked for a additional night (4th) once there. Original rate was $219.00 per night plus tax and $5. something for use of phone that never could dial outside, plus safe in room. Was charged over $380.00 for one more night, called front desk and questioned?? was told manager could increase rates at any time they wanted. Although the 2008 brochure at the front desk rates are set in writing. Within small print it does state prices are subject to change, Stayed in the double suite overlooking the pool. Dirty under pull out couch, beds and bathroom tub scum. Front desk rude and uncertain of rates and many other things. Should be drug tested before hiring. Parking......Good luck, they offer parking under canopy(holds about 30 cars) or 2 blocks away that you can pay for. The food at the pool bar is slow and very expensive, the bar claims to stay open until 2:00 a.m. but was always in a rush to get you out and close up by 12:00 - 12:30. Ice makers on 5th and 4th floor are always broke, you can walk to 3rd and get some if not out. DO NOT USE THE SAFE in the room, hotel employees can.do access these. Test yourself, tell the staff at desk you forgot your combination to the safe and see how fast they open it for you????? Room service came into my room although I requested NO service. The pool is very small and is advertised as being open to the public, so it gets packed by everyone that is not staying there. This is in hopes of attracting people to the pool for sales of food and drinks at there bar. You feel you are sharing your whole vacation with everyone. Lounge chairs are taken up by the pool by other vacationers. Stay home before you stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Won't Be Back”
Reviews.Author: BuddyM44
Reviews.Content: Our family has been taking shore vacations for many years, never stayed in a place that was so "DIRTY"..... The housekeeping was the worst I have ever seen. The bed linens and towels were full of hair. The floors had sand all over them. The toiletries in the room were never replenished. The stove didn't work and the dishes were dirty. No pillows or blankets for the pull out sofa either. The ice machine didn't work properly and cost money. I have never stayed in a hotel that you had to pay for ice. Our room was across from the area where trash was disposed. When you walked out in the hall way, it actually made you sick to your stomach........ My daughter was pregnant so needless to say, she actually had to cover her face before she left the room because it gaged her. This was the worst thing I have ever experienced in all my years of traveling. The pool area was very slippery in many places, as my granddaughter couldn't even 'WALK' NOT RUN BEFORE SHE WAS ON THE GROUND. When I went to check-out, I expressed my concern with our stay and it was if they could care less. They really had no response, just stood there....... The poorest customer service ever.... They had your money so just keep moving. This was true, however we will not be returning to that disgusting place ever again..... A vacation is supposed to be good memories, not one that you just want to forget that you were ever there. This place ruined our family vacation ............

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, Moldy,Musty Smelling Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Raven1WestVirginia
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 nights at $1035, only stayed 2, didn't recieve any money back. Room was filthy, bathroom had mold on walls and sink didn't drain. Under pull out sofa there was a lighter, shower cap, bandaid, and years of dirt. Old mattresses, very uncomfortable, no blankets or mattress covers. Didn't want to sit on furniture it was too dirty. The hotel staff was just as bad as the room. This hotel falsely portrays itself, don't make the same costly mistake our family made. Ocean City has a great beach and boardwalk, but staying at the Tidelands ruined our family vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “rude & dirty”
Reviews.Author: stoppp
Reviews.Content: I have been staying att his hotel for 6 years. Use tolove it good deals nice location etc...But this year I found teh hotel rooms very dirty. Beer bottles dirty & body waste everywhere. I had my room changed three times. Each room same old problem. When I complain the front desk said o well. I did not recieve anything for my terrible stay. I will not be using this hotel in the furture.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: PROMANO4
Reviews.Content: This place looked nice from the outside but what a joke, the rooms was never cleaned up, trash every where. Talked to the manager about it and nothing was ever done. I really don't think this place was even up to fire code. The first room was filled with a nasty smell, trash in the steps.Lots of drunks on both sides, tryed 3 rooms thinking it would get better but thay got worse one had no lighting at all. NEVER AGAIN,,,,, HARVEY JEWELL [---315-2273] Please don't waste your money. And you will NOT get any of your money back or knocked off of your bill.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place--Bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: junepearl609
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a nice hotel but a little run down. I stayed in dbl queen w/sofabed. Nice large room w/ walking room. Came w/table and chairs as well. Had direct ocean front balacony which is nice in the morning. At night can be noisy due to boardwalk and others on their balacony. Bathtub had a stain so could not take a bath and there was some mildrew in shower. You do get a coffee maker but no coffee so be sure to bring. There is plates, cups, spoons, and a pan for cooking as you get a mini fridge, stove, microwave, toaster, and coffee pot. The floor is nice as there is no carpet. No fitted sheets on bed nor a blanket. Was a full sheet w/a comforter. Remote for TV had no back cover and the clock radio was broke. The staff does not bother you as you come and go at your will. The resturant was just ok as I went for breakfast one day and everything served on paper plates and paper cups. Overall though I would stay here for the location. 3 nights total w/ tax $650. a bit high but the location is excellent. Hope you enjoy and can contact me if any other queestions.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK-Hoping Hojos is better this year!”
Reviews.Author: Star9
Reviews.Content: My fiancee' and I stayed there last year along with his son and his son's fiancee'. We booked two separate ocean view rooms. Rooms were sort of run down looking-AND a little dirty. Hallways were dirty and full of trash . I guess because it was Senior week. The elevator was a little rickety and was very overused by the kids packing in it and riding up and down all night long. Lots of noise during Senior week. Very hard to sleep. Water was pretty hot in shower-A DEFINITE PLUS!!!! Would stay there again, but not during Senior week. I always bring my own Clorox to clean the bathroom no matter where I stay and would recommend doing the same if you go ANYWHERE !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: VacaysRock
Reviews.Content: I was worried after reading some of the other reviews, its really not that bad. The room was clean which is the most important thing for me. The beds were a little saggy which is usually the case at Ocean City hotels. The room had a mini fridge, microwave and coffee pot, they all look fairly clean but old, the microwave had a oniony smell the few times we used it, so I opened the balcony door to air it out. Didn't use the coffee pot, and as stated in other reviews no coffee supplies are provided, which I found a little odd. We were on the 3rd floor ocean block so we did have a small view of the ocean and boardwalk which was nice. One annoying thing was the fact the shower had to be on for about 10 or 15 mins before the water got hot and the water pressure was low. The tile floor in the room was mopped while we were there although we kept flip flops on whenever walking in the room. Ended up staying there 6 days, went for the kite festival and then stayed a few more. We would definitely stay here again if we get a good price on the room. The cleaning people and front desk clerks all seemed pleasant enough while we were there. Only one night out of six we couldn't find a parking spot on the on site lot, in season i'm sure its much worse. There is another lot a block or so away for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: KCashVa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very run down. Bathroom stains, paint coming off the walls, no balcony furniture, no table or desk in the room. Small fridge, microwave, toaster and coffee maker stacked up like building blocks. The location is very good, but its SO noisy at night until about 3am. Very limited parking. The pool and pool bar were the best part, then they decided to close it before Labor Day. What? Unless the price is right, I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: shelley_hall
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews I was horrified. I was going to cancel the room and try to reserve elsewhere. I am so glad I didn't. Check in wasn't until 3 but we got there around 12 and our room was ready so they let us check in. The staff was courteous. The room was huge and super clean! I asked for an received extra pillows and towels. The bed was soft and the sheets were clean. There is not carpet in the rooms, it is all tile. There wasn't any sand on the tile until after we came back from the beach and tracked some back in. The only downside was parking. There isn't enough parking near the hotel so a few times we had to park two blocks down in their other lot and walk to the hotel. That happens at a lot of hotels in Ocean City though. The pools were small but clean. I wish they had a hot tub, but they don't. The bar was nice. The bartender was extremely pleasant. Contential breakfast is NOT offered so don't expect it. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. We had a king size room for 2 nights and it only costed $245 with tax!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, horrible pricing, horrible place!”
Reviews.Author: lousue369
Reviews.Content: Been there, done that, never EVER EVER AGAIN!!! Crap hole!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One Big Disapointment”
Reviews.Author: PennsylvaniaTone
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to begin, first of all the parking is terrible. This over priced dump, was so filthy that I don't think I'll ever forget it. Lets start with the walk through the hallway to our room. I don't know what died, but they need to investigate it. It smelled so bad that I covered my nose just to walk through it. The stairwell wasn't any better. Then, as we opened the door to the room you could tell right away it was dirty (and also smelled like roadkill). Half of the lights in the room didn't work, the safe was broken, the ceiling in the bathroom was caving in, not to mention all the mold that was growing all over the place, toenail clippings on the balcony (GROSS!!!!!) and the food that was left laying on the floor, it was so nasty that my friend or myself never walked in the room without our shoes on. The beds were old and in very much in need of changing. I still can't believe I slept there. We paid alot of money to stay there and we were very excited about our trip to Ocean City. This hotel was our only disapointment. In my opinion, they should tear it down and start all over again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as we were led to believe!”
Reviews.Author: Darkpurple
Reviews.Content: My husband and I vacationed at the Tidelands Carribean in Ocean City Maryland last week. I had checked on Trip Advisor and was told it was recently remodeled and clean. We had some problems with this hotel. First, I paid my deposit and upon receiving my credit card bill I noticed that I was charged twice for my deposit. I immediately contacted Tidelands and was told I would need to bring my bill along to show them upon check-in. I presented my bill to the gentleman at the desk and was told he could do nothing about it and that I would have to wait until the next day and meet with the manager. The next morning I took some time out of my vacation schedule and went looking for a manager only to be told that the person on the desk could help me. He looked at my bill and said that he would have to check into the matter and I should come back later. Upon my return I was told that yes I was charged twice but that I was not charged the correct amount for my room and that I now owed an additional $158. and they were giving me a break! Our rooms, if newly remodeled, were not very clean and there was paint hanging loose from the ceiling and rust on the walls in the bathroom. The tubs had old rubber mats to prevent you from slipping but they were hard and had knobs on them that hurt your feet. Our room had a terrible odor and our patio was full of cigarette butts. To make matters go from bad to worse, we arrived back at our hotel on Friday night only to find NO PARKING spaces left. We were told we should park on another hotels parking lot (that was closed for remodeling) and upon arrival we found it to be full of nails, wood and other construction materials. Needless to say we are very unimpressed with this place of business! We do have reservations at the Tides again for Sunfest and are hoping that we will be able to write that we had a better experience!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, Terrible”
Reviews.Author: d75angel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 4 nights and left after the first night. The hotel was poorly kept and the service was horrible. We had not towels in our room and upon requesting them, didnt receive them until 7pm. We opted to leave after the first night despite losing the money was paid for the stay.

Reviews.Title: “left a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: travelguyNycNy
Reviews.Content: We had trouble from checkin on. . The room 314 was not ready until after 3pm. After i checked in I noticed a large patch of black mold on the ceiling by the bathroom. When I went to complain, the manager Mike ,moved me to an even less desirable room, located out by the street ,where unruly's were partying all hours of the night. Additionally this is the only hotel i stayed at where you have to pay for ice.. For a pricey hotel the halls and carpets were run down. I would recommend checking out different hotels in the area. It's plus side was the location right on the boarrdwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to Improve their Services!”
Reviews.Author: dramatravel
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Tidelands and was very disappointed with their services. I booked the trip because family members had suggested it. There were four people in in my party, so we had a nice suit with 2 king size beds, bathroom, and kitchen. However, the matresses were terribly uncomfortable. There were 2 flat pillows for each bed. When we asked for 2 more pillows, they simply replied,"we don't have extra." We wanted to use the kiosk in the lobby to print coupons and maps of places to go/things to do, and the desk worker said, "Oh it's out of paper.' I asked if there was anything else they could give us and their simple answer was,"No." We weren't greeted once when we entered the building. The workers were too busy playing solitare on the computer. I work in the hospitality industry, and this was one of the worst experiences I have had. The workers were not friendly and of no help. I know we only paid $1000 to stay there, but you think we would have been treated like guests on vacation..I guess not.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay at Tidelands”
Reviews.Author: V3MP
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 just returned from 4 nights in Ocean City, MD We enjoyed our stay at Tidelands Caribbean Hotel. The location was the BEST thing about our trip. Price is questionable, BUT Being within walking distance to the Boardwalk, Beach & Restaurants was wonderful. Last year was our 1st visit to OC and we stayed near the 98th Street section of town and had to drive down to the "action" every evening and this was much better. Our children are 14 & 11 and being able to walk up and down the Boardwalk and find something to do for all ages is what brought us back. We also were able to WALK to Bay area and rode The Adrenaline for the 2nd year in a row & loved it. The hotel was pretty much on key to the ratings, pros & cons, that we had read before we left. We stayed in a 2 room King Suite on the 3rd floor facing Baltimore Ave. The bedding & towels were clean, however we did have to ask for more towels the 1st night & they were brought to us immediately with a smile. I did leave $2 a day with a note of our request & never had to ask again. The dishes that they provide were not cleaned to my expectations so we went to the grocery store & bought plastic. The coffee maker, toaster & microwave were all that we used & all worked fine. It would have been nice if they would have told us that they only provide the "coffee maker" we could have taken coffee & filters with us. Since they didn't (and don't most hotels offer their little sample packs with the machine??) we also bought that at the store. I was a little disappointed with the housekeeping of the tile floors. I realize it's hard to keep sand out and we did our best to rinse off before entering, but our room had mounds of sand from previous occupants and it was never cleaned up. We wore our shoes all the time. (Next year the Dust Buster will join us)The room had a "scent" but I had taken a Plug-In along (in case of getting a smokey room as a previous review stated) and that helped out a lot. The beds were very "hard", but clean bedding, so we survived. We arrived 2 hours before check-in and they gave us our parking permit and allowed us to use the pool until our room was ready at 2p.m. 2 families in front of us had issues & I was almost afraid to to see our room, but we were fine. Nothing fancy, nice size, clean (for the most part) and wonderful location for children that need entertainment. Parking IS interesting, but we didn't mind the short walk to the other lot. On our last evening there (Sat), the other lot was filled as well and when we checked in with the desk they allowed for us to park in their delivery zone, since it would only be for over night & we felt it was safe, well lit and we were pleased that they were so accomodating. We will go back to Tidelands in the future. The staff was always very friendly & helpful and the location is basically what you pay for. Enjoy OC - we do!! V3MP from New Philadelphia, OHIO

Reviews.Title: “Not as Nice as the Hotel Ads”
Reviews.Author: Poggy05
Reviews.Content: The furnishings were OK, but the beds were saggy. There was hardly any water pressure in the bathrom sink. The rooftop pool was small,and the 2nd floor pool was a little bigger with a small bar. When we came back from Dinner there was no parking left in the Hotel lot, They had another lot a couple of blocks down! We decided to pay for parking that night to get close to the hotel. They do not have near enough parking! They only had one small elevator for each lobby. We had to wait for the elevator alot to get up to our room.

Reviews.Title: “could have been better”
Reviews.Author: beachlover20
Reviews.Content: First off, the hotel has two buildings with separate lobbies which I was unaware of. I registered in one, had to drive to the next building and search for parking! We unloaded the car and had to search the hotel for a luggage cart that had wheels that did not want to move. Once we got to our floor, it reaked of OLD cigarette smoke. We were put on a smoking floor! WE agreed we could take it. Our room was nice with tile floors, not so great for sandy feet! We noticed someone had stuck a bathing suit crotch liner on the wall! YUCK! How the maid could have overlooked something so obvious was questionable. It stayed there for four days! No coffee for the coffee maker too! The bathroom was small and the toilet seat was stained with cigarette burns. The location of the room and the view was great! We could sit and look at the boardwalk and ocean. The hotel roof pool was "under construction" which was a major disappointment since the hotel brochure boasts of a rooftop pool and hot tubs and an amazing view! We couldn't even get to the roof past the signs! The hotel pool bar was nice, but the drinks were over priced and priced differently in the menus from what we were charged! I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey for what you get”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkBeachmom
Reviews.Content: We had a difficult time making a reservation - when I called to reserve, a very unfriendly staffer said rooms were completely booked for the first 3 weeks in July, even though the hotel's website showed available rooms. After hanging up, I reserved an ocean view room easily through the website...The room was beautiful, view was wonderful. Downsides: parking is ridiculous, we had to park blocks away in the overflow lot. When paying almost $300 a night, I expect a parking space. One of the pools was closed, and everyone packed into the 1 existing tiny pool. Our building's soda/water machine and ice machines were out of order, so we had to walk to the adjacent building. I don't mind doing these things at a regular hotel room, but again, for $300 you expect a little more in terms of service and maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tidelands! Will go back!”
Reviews.Author: NDH_7
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to the Tidelands Caribbean! We went on July 9-13 and stayed for 4 nights. I went with my husband and daugher who is 2 years old. We had a wonderful time. I must say that I was in a total panic when my husband suggested that we book a spur of the moment trip to Ocean City. I panicked because we have stayed at total dives at Myrtle Beach for slightly less money. I figured the hotels at O.C. would not be kept up, I was wrong! I have not stayed in Ocean City since 1987 when I was very young. It seems as though a lot of the city has been overhauled. I looks great! I had originally booked a large family themed resort further down the ocean and after reading horrible reviews, I took advantage of their cancellation policy and cancelled. I then found a super price on Orbitz for the Tidelands. I do know of 2 families that have recently stayed there and they both enjoyed their stay. I took a chance with the Tidelands and almost had a panic attack after we booked because of some of the reviews on this site. I promised that if all went well, I would write a positive review. All went well and here is my positive review! We had a 2 room suite with 2 king sized beds. The room was huge and we had plently of room for all of our luggage, toys, etc. We overlooked Baltimore Avenue which was fine with me... it was last minute. The suite was painted pink and it did have tile floors, which I loved. I don't even want to think about what is in the carpet of those other hotels that don't use tile. It was nicely furnished with dark furniture. As I said, I have paid the same amount per night for dismal rooms with way less space. The room was clean, cute, and felt very tropical. I had no problems with the decor or the layout of the room. It was more than adequate. The staff at the front desk were all very nice and helpful. I even asked to see the ocean front rooms if we ever stay there again and I was given a tour. They too were nice. The housekeeping staff was also nice and helpful. The location was perfect and we could not have been more convenient to the boardwalk. It was perfect for my toddler. Some things that others have had problems with, thankfully did not happen to us. The parking lot was fine. Of the times we took our car out, we only had to go to the overflow lot, which is one block away, once. The garage under the hotel was just fine. Mostly everyone has trucks or SUV's so that is of course what you'll see there. The pool on the front building was undergoing renovations so we did only have one small pool on the back building where the grill is located. The pool was large enough to accomodate the guests. If I had to name one "negative" it was that there was an overwhelming smell of garbage permeating the air at the pool. The back of the pool faces an alley which has many dumpsters and I think that is where the smell was coming from. Not what I wanted to smell at the pool on the beach. It seemed better on the last day, perhaps the garbage man had come. A good perk was that at the pool, a fun clown named Lolipop came and made balloon animals for the kids... for free. That was fun. I hope this helps. I drove up and down the strip and looked at other hotels and I loved this one. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: octriptaker
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good but not great. As expected parking was at a premium due to the limited space. We did get a space every time we went out but if you did not have to go don't. (If you do not get a parking spot they have another lot 4 or 5 blocks away across busy streets) We arrived about 20 min before the 3pm check-in and requested a non-smoking room. We were told that our room was not ready but come back at 3pm and everything would be ready. Well arrived back at 3:02pm and our room was given away. We ended up with a smoking room. This was the worst part of our stay. We basically stayed in a dirty ashtray the 4 days 3 nights we spent here. The cleaning staff was very helpful and provided sprays to help with the smell and we open the patio door all the way and eventually the smell subsided but was not gone completely. The manager offered to move us to a Suite (and not charge the difference) but it did not have an Ocean View so we decided not to move our second day into the trip. Also the sheets were as expected due to some other reviews. The hotel does not use fitted sheets so if you move around a lot at night expect to sleep on the mattress. All in all this hotel is average. Service was good and the hotel was mostly clean. The hallways and common areas needed some cleaning but our room was very well kept and the cleaning staff answered all our calls. If we had to stay again we would stay but would arrive early like we did and wait for the non-smoking room to make sure we get it.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martin11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night during Memorial Day Weekend for a decent rate around $150 for that this time of year. Everything else was lower $200 and up when shopping online. I booked our room as an OceanView room with double Queen beds. When we arrived I was a little startled to find out that my online reservation through the internet had not gone through. Fortunately the manager said that they still had a room available for us and he seemed to be willing to find accomodations for us even if only a better room had been available. Room - Just a few comments so that you know what to expect. The ocean view turned out to be a view of the ocean from an angle down the road. I guess I was expecting too much for the price I paid and maybe the rooms right on the boardwalk were much more expensive than ours. I believe we stayed in the older part of the hotel although it was painted nicely. The room was clean on the inside. However the outside windows were dirty to point that you could not see out of them. We wet a couple of hand towels and wiped them down ourselves. It came with 2 queen beds (I guess what Hotels consider queens) which were too soft. Really to point of sagging a little. But the night's sleep was ok. The room did have a refrig and microwave, but no table to eat on and no chairs in the room. So you had to eat on the floor or the bed. The room had no coffee maker and no ice bucket (This is like a gimme at most hotels). Luckily I had a mini cooler to put ice in and soon found that ice cost .25 cents for about a half mini-cooler worth. The bathroom seemed clean enough and you did get a iron and hair dryer. Oh yeah - just like everyone says - there are no fitted sheets. They slide all over the place during the night. Oh no wireless internet access (Although the nearby comfort inn's signal showed up - it required login). Service - Everyone seemed polite and helpful. We forgot a toothbrush and asked if they had any complimentary ones at the front desk (They didn't). But they pointed us to the nearest convenient store (2 blocks away). Turned out the little market was 24hours and offered grill food and other little handy things you might need. Yes parking is cramped, unless you are lucky enough to park between the buildings like we did and there are a limited number of spots. (There are two buildings one old and one new). I think the overflow lot is a couple of blocks away. Location - this is really the best part of you get for your stay. You are right on the boardwalk near everything. Subway is 2 blocks away,Baskin-Robins is righ there as well as Shenanigans Irish Pub. Overall - In my opinion this Hotel is average. It's also very tough to determine the type of room you are getting from the website. I chose this hotel originally based on other reviewer's comments. If you have to pay alot of money to stay here, I wouldn't. Anything above $200 I would be searching for a Holiday Inn or Hilton or something. Although granted I did not stay in there more expensive suites so my point of view could be skewed. I think there are alot of little things that it could improve upon to be top notch. Services that you expect at a Hotel that I think would not cost them much and would be a good investment to keep people coming back (Free ice, fitted sheets, better website description of rooms, table to eat on, cofee maker, complimentary toothbrush). Would I stay here again - probably not unless it was the only thing available and the rate was good. I would definitely look for better next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MCJJJJ
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay last minute through Expedia after reading reviews on trip advisor. We wanted to get a good price, but also not stay in a dive...The rate I got was excellent, but I was worried that the rooms would not be nice. Upon checking in we were upgraded to a 2 room suite. The room was great. Ceramic tile, jacuzzi tub, 2 king beds, SMALL kitchenette that divided the 2 rooms. It was great for a long weekend! The staff was friendly the pool bar was nice. This is a great hotel on the boardwalk. If the smell of smoke bothers you , I would definately request a non smoking floor. The second floor (pool bar building)was definately a smoking floor. You could smell it as soon as you exit the elevator. This was not the case on the other floors. I definately recomend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaQueen
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. I booked 12 rooms for myself and my associates. Anyone that has ever done anything like that before knows, it takes several calls to the hotel and a host of issues can arise. I was fortunate enough to be working with JR at the hotel. He was really on the ball....top notch! JR was at the front desk when my group arrived. We were greeted with enthusiasm and professionalism. The hotel is in a great location, the rooms were as pictured and very clean. The sunrise from the balcony was breath taking. The entire staff was very accommodating... even with off the wall requests. It was clear, their aim was to serve. There wasn't a single issue among the 12 rooms and 23 guests that occupied those rooms. Congratulations!!!! I think that is a first for my group!! One of my associates had to leave after the first night because his father's kidneys shut down and he had to go back to Virginia quickly. Do you know that this fabulous hotel OFFERED to refund his credit card for the second night. How great is that!! A hotel with a heart!!! We will be back, every year.....and we'll spread the word... you guys are just fabulous! Thanks Again, Susan Thomas Hampton, Virginia

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently surprised!”
Reviews.Author: scamp588
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews I was a little worried that I may have made a mistake when I booked our stay at this hotel. But I am happy to say that everything was great! We arrived at about 1:00 p.m. on friday, april 13th. Check-in is supposed to be after 3:00 p.m., but we were graciously invited in as soon as we pulled into the parking area. The man & young lady at the front desk were very polite, I wish I would have gotten their names. The room, which was an ocean front room, was very clean & had a terrific view of the ocean & boardwalk. We had 2 king beds, a pull out sofa, small refrigerator, a 2 burner stove, toaster, coffee pot, iron & ironing board, plates, bowls & silverware. There was also some cookware that we used to cook our breakfasts. I can honestly say that I do not have even one complaint about our stay at the Tidelands Carribean. My family & I will most definitley stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: bbz
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at the Tidelands Caribbean Hotel- What a pleasant suprise!! Our family travels to Ocean City often, and we have stayed at several hotels on and off the Boardwalk. The Tidelands is definately one of the nicer hotels we have stayed at in OC. The location is great- within walking distance to many of the Boardwalk attractions. Parking was not a problem during our visit- I was able to park underneath the building all three nights. The room was nice! Great view from the balcony!!! We had an oceanview room on the fourth floor with two king beds and a pull out sofa. The floors are all ceramic tile, which is a nice touch. The bathroom was a little on the small side but was kept clean and functional. There was a small kitchenette stocked with dishes and utensils. My only complaint with the room was the poor condition of the sheets on the bed. There were several stains and a cigarette burn. The hotel apparently doesnt use fitted sheets, and they kept coming off during the night. Otherwise, the room was very clean and furnishings looked new. Customer service was fantastic. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The smell of death!”
Reviews.Author: Brianaerin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a two night trip. The first night we stayed at the Hilton. The second night, the Hilton was booked so we decided to try the Tidelands. What a mistake. We looked around the hotel before check in. The stairs leading up to the pool was blocking with plies of bags full of garbage. I am glad there wasn't a fire. The carpets in the hall had stains which looked like vomit. The halls were filthy and covered with holes. The placed smelled like something had died in there. At check in, the employees seemed to care less if you were there. It seemed like we were bothering them. It would not hurt to say Hi or even a thank you for staying with us. We got up to our room and the place was disgusting. The people before us left us their soap and washcloth in the tub. The toilet was obvioiusly NOT cleaned at all. The toliet was coming up off the floor, it seemed like you were going to slide off. The mildew or black stains around the entire bathroom was very gross. The rooftop was was a joke. It was very small and they had a snow fence plastic gate blocking the side of the pool off. The medal gate had plastic ties holding it together. I am glad our stay was only one night, but even that was too long. I would have felt cleaner and safer sleeping in my car. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “good - if price is right -only”
Reviews.Author: guffin
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location on the boardwalk. A Dunkin Donuts is within 50 ft of entrance for true coffee drinkers:) The rooms are extremely large with great beds. The cleaning staff was attentive when asked. The down side was moldy(blue) 3ft by 5ft spot on ceiling,molding on bathroom sink coming out,railing on balcony awful as were chairs with dirt and bird ----. The check in was difficult in that apparently Expedia is not used here much and not understood. No big welcome here-no smiles,etc. The phone did not work unless you pressed keys in certain way only. I asked for new one-no deal. This hotel is tired - from check in to rooms. I would not pay more then $65-$75 a night. I give it 2 stars out of 5

Reviews.Title: “Exterior in better shape than Interior”
Reviews.Author: lsb040
Reviews.Content: I apologize in advance for the length of this review. However, since I wouldn't consider booking a hotel without reading reviews on tripadvisor.com, I assume if you're reading this, you'd like information on the property provided by someone who stayed there, letting you make an informed decision. My husband and I stayed in an OF room 9/2-9 and it wasn’t the best or the worst hotel we’ve stayed at in OC. The room was of a decent size with an adequate amount of drawer space. The draperies, bedspreads and furniture were all in good condition – and we liked the cornice over the sliders that helped keep out the light in the morning. The web site says the rooms were recently renovated, which was evident, but it was a surface overhaul. The repainted room was marred by the rusted and molded venting in the sleeping portion of the room and the mold on the ceiling. While the bathroom and kitchenette areas may have been repainted, they were not remodeled and showed signs of wear. The slider to the balcony was so difficult to open and close we just stopped trying, which is a shame considering you pay extra for a direct oceanfront room. It took two days, but a note to the maid resulted in getting a lightbulb replaced and the safe unlocked so we could use it, which we appreciated. Housekeeping was lackluster and uneven. Aside from the floor, I don’t believe the bathroom was cleaned during the entire week of our stay. The room had a kitchenette (small refrigerator, microwave and two electric burners). There was a frying pan, a few plates and utensils and glasses. If there was an ice bucket in the room, I didn’t see it. Other reviewers have mentioned numerous things that I’ll list here just for further confirmation: - The sheets do come off the mattress during the night. - I liked the tile flooring, but it does make it tough to get the sand off your feet, which becomes an issue if they don’t change your sheets daily, which was my experience. - There are no blankets on the beds and none in the room. Just the sheet and bedspread . No extra pillows – and what are provided are pretty flat. We each needed to use two. - No name toiletries provided upon arrival are all you'll get, even if you use them up - bring your own. - There is not enough parking directly at the hotel and those spots are EXTREMELY tight, but they do have auxiliary/overflow parking 2 blocks over at 5th & Philadelphia Ave. This is not an unusual situation, as land is at a premium in OC and I’ve encountered the same thing at other OF hotels. No one objected when we parked briefly right outside the lobby door while we unloaded our vehicle after checking in. This is one benefit of staff that is apathetic. - Only one elevator in the OF building. - The hallways/corridors were warm and smelled funky. We initially attributed that to the power having been out for the 14 hours before our arrival due to a storm (Ernesto), but they remained the same throughout our week's stay. Either we were extremely lucky with quiet fellow guests or the hotel has decent soundproofing, which is not the case at many OC hotels. We heard little noise from either the boardwalk or other rooms. The fire alarm went off one late afternoon during our stay and the alarm sound is not very loud, nor does it sound like any fire alarms I’ve heard before. I was taking a bath with the fan running and didn’t hear it at all (but I am hard of hearing). Seriously, if your hearing isn’t good, make sure you stay with someone of normal hearing. We evacuated and only knew it was OK to return inside by hearing a hotel staff person talking on a cell phone. I pursued them and asked if we could go inside and was told yes, but they made no effort to communicate this information to the guests standing outside. Aside from the balcony door, everything was in working order in the room. Good A/C, refrigerator kept things cold, bathtub drained, toilets flushed, TV worked. I didn’t get the sense the hotel was well run or managed. While they weren’t rude, the young people encountered at the front desk were apathetic and not friendly. You get the impression they're on the defensive (and wonder what they've encountered to make them like this). You were neither welcomed at check in, nor thanked for your patronage at check out – you were just an interruption from sitting and staring into space and a transaction - there was no interaction other than the request for your name or room number. The hotel isn't exactly security minded, as the stairwell from the 5th street side was unlocked any time of night or day and held open with a large rock most of the time. This means anyone from the street can enter the hotel without going through the lobby, which was convenient for us since the hotel has but one elevator, but be aware of this! The hotel is in a prime location and has the makings of a really wonderful hotel if they just paid a little more attention to the details, had a staff trained in customer service, provided a few additional basic amenities and more than the cursory cleaning effort that consisted of little more than changing the towels and making the bed was made. (I found out after the fact my generous husband was leaving the maid a $5 daily tip, so either tipping isn't a motivator or I'd hate to see what you'd get in the way of cleaning without a tip.) If the interior of the hotel was as well maintained as the exterior of the hotel, this would be a great property. I realize beach properties are difficult to maintain and while this wasn’t what we’d consider a well run or maintained property, it wouldn’t prevent me from staying again – but only if other more preferred properties in the same price range weren’t available (which is why we stayed here this year). I believe you have to lower your standards a bit at any beach location, as it's so hard to combat the elements. While this property had it's deficiencies, it's still probably among the nicer moderately priced hotels. The bottom line is that the hotel was OK, nothing really objectionable but it didn't impress us either.

Reviews.Title: “TIdelands pros & cons”
Reviews.Author: missush
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the hotel from 8/28-8/31, this was our 2nd stay. I have to agree with previous posters...if you want to be near all the action of the b'walk, this is definitely the place to be. The weekday rate during this time was very reasonable and you can't beat being literally a few steps from the beach. We were in a 2-rm suite on the 4th floor with a poolview. The room was just OK. I noticed some of the same issues I had from 2005--the panel was missing from the fake drawer front below the sink; water pressure in shower horrible; the walls needed to be repainted; the fitted sheet issue; the broken ice machine; the exit doors leading to the parking lot not locking properly; the bad parking situation. I, too, was concerned about how well they cleaned the tile floors. Our floor had sand on it when we first walked in and it was never completely cleaned during our stay. I noticed a small sand pile in the bathroom on our first day and by check out time it was still there which leads me to believe that housekeeping is not doing a thorough job. Our toilet bowl needed a good scrubbing and the tub had a ring in it from the moment we walked in. It was never cleaned. On our third day, I dropped an earring behind one of the nightstands and discovered a half-eaten piece of bread/roll. Again, housekeeping needs to be addressed. Management would be wise to spend a night in their own hotel to get a feel for what their customers' experience would be like. Or make random inspections. Many of my complaints and those of others are not hard to solve. Overall, the hotel is not bad. I've seen worse and paid more. I'd probably stay there again, but I will be doing research on other hotels for next year. It's a shame because they have many things in their favor--price, location, but they don't seem to put much of their profits back into the place. The hallway carpet and wallpaper needs to be replaced. I appreciate the upgrades they did make, but there's still more work to be done.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK!”
Reviews.Author: SVEND
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tidelands 8/24 - 8/28, 2 adults and 2 children, ages 9 & 12. We stayed in the two room suites on the third floor overlooking the pool and pool bar. Room was large and spacious. Small refridgerator, microwave, two burner stove, plates, cups, forks/knives and a couple of frying pans are included in the room. Nice tiled floors in suite but had to walk with shoes on all the time or you'll end up with sand in your bed. Pool bar can get a little loud after 11:00 p.m. but air conditioning drowned out most of the noise. Called front desk several times for extra towels, blankets, toilet paper, etc. Never had a problem. They were there within 15 minutes Both pools need a good cleaning! A little chlorine wouldn't hurt either. Even though pools are small, it was nice to have two pools on property. Even nicer to have a drink by the pool sitting on a lounge chair! Never had a problem getting a parking spot, and we used our car a lot, but I think we were just very lucky. We noticed that the better restaurants and food establishments are away from the boardwalk. Had an excellent meal at a Mexican Restaurant called Tequilla Mockingbird! Our only real complaint was the attitude of the Russian/Polish employees. A local confirmed that the kids who work in Ocean City are mostly Russian with a small percentage from Poland. We were taken back with their poor attitude towards us. They were not helpful at all when asked for advice or help. This was not just at the hotel but everywhere we went, restaurants, amusement parks, water parks, food stands, etc. Since we were on vacation we were very happy people and more then happy to spend our money. We ended up leaving a few establishments beacuse of their attitude Would we return to the Tidelands? Probably not. Next time we'll probably stay in a condo away from the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Tidelands Caribbean OK”
Reviews.Author: calaflpa
Reviews.Content: I've stayed several places in OC over the years. Tidelands is a definitely a premium location IF you want to be near the south end of the boardwalk and the amusements. Plusses are the refer and microwave. Rooms are fairly large and all have a good size balcony. Our room had a tile floor which is easier to clean and cooler but also makes it hard to keep sand out of the beds. I used a damp bathmat in front of the beds that you could wipe your feet off before getting into bed. AC unit worked great. Negatives are parking. They have limited parking on site (which was full) and an overflow lot two blocks east that had about two spots left in it. The overflow lot is a little inconvenient if you want to be able to access stuff in your car like boogie boards, etc. rather than lug them back and forth to your room which may be 5 floors up. Also, they don't have any outdoor showers that are convenient, only a foot shower near the main lobby. A previous reviewer mentioned the lack of fitted sheets, I agree this is a problem that should be easily fixed if they wanted to. After reading his review I specifically looked at the sheets and they are too short and it was a constant problem with the sheets coming off of the bed at night. The rooftop pool is extremely small and the larger pool, near the suites is adjacent to a bar and grill that is open to the public. Location may make the Tidelands better than average depending on your needs, but in all other aspects it is average. I would not hesitate to stay there again, but then again there is nothing "special" about it that would make me loyal to them either.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for about 10 minutes”
Reviews.Author: peachkins
Reviews.Content: We were extremely disappointed in this hotel. So unhappy, in fact, that we left before staying a single night. We were supposed to have an ocean-view room, and at $300 a night we wanted to see and hear the ocean. The hotel is divided into two main buildings: one that is right on the boardwalk where the oceanfront rooms are located, and the other is on the main road. We figured we would at least be in the building closest to the beach. We were wrong. Our "ocean view" was a two inch glimpse of the ocean between two other buildings. Our room basically overlooked the parking lot next door and the main road. The traffic was extremely noisy, and when you're staying in a room with young children this can be a problem. And who wants to sit on the balcony and listen to all that? Not that I would sit on the furniture that was out there. It was filthy. The room was also disappointing. The only good things about it were the king-sized beds. The room just didn't seem clean. A lot of reviewers on here say they liked the tile floors, but I have to disagree. I thought the tile was kind of gross-I mean I have to wonder how they clean it. Do they just sweep the loose stuff up or do they actually (hopefully) mop and dry the whole thing. I wouldn't have felt comfortable walking on it in my bare feet. Again, it just didn't seem clean. To top it off, the front was missing off the bathroom sink. Very attractive. If this was supposed to be a newly renovated room I shudder to think of what the old room looked like. Perhaps I'm seeming a bit picky, but keep in mind people are paying more than $300 a night during the summer to stay at this place. After seeing the room and our "ocean view," we decided to call another hotel down the street that we had stayed at before. The only reason we had booked the Tidelands was because our other hotel required a 3-night minimum and, at the time, we didn't meet it. We had changed our plans to include a 3 night stay, so our regular hotel was able to accomodate us on incredibly short notice. At our regular hotel-the Quality Inn Beachfront-we got a gorgeous second-floor, oceanfront suite with a private balcony and an incredible oceanfront view. We ended up getting this room for less $ over the 3 nights than what the Tidelands cost. We ended up checking out before we stayed a single hour at the Tidelands. They are still planning on charging us for the 3 nights we reserved there and we intend to dispute the charge, since the hotel has a strict no-refund policy. All the credit card asked for was proof that we had checked out before staying a full night. Getting any of the staff there to do this was like pulling teeth. Needless to say, we will never reserve a room there again.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: susanjc
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Tidelands and were a little disappointed in the hotel. We stayed in room 420 which is the 2 room suite. I had stayed in the same type of room 2 years ago and at that time the room was very nice. The rooms are starting to look run down, badly needing new paint, mold on the bathroom wall. I know OC is expensive but for $932 for 3 nights you expect a little cleaner. Also when the maid cleaned our room she never made the other bed, even though my daughter slept in it and didn't give us shampoo or more than 3 towels. Also if you book a corner room which 420 is there are side windows which would be nice if they had curtains that shut out the light. All they have are white blinds that do not shut out any light. They were fully booked so we couldn't change rooms, so I had to go to Walmart and buy a black sheet and tumb tacks so the sunlight wouldn't shine in at 6 am. I think next time we would try a hotel that is new that year. The Breakers next door looked quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “the only good thing was the location”
Reviews.Author: OCBeachgoers
Reviews.Content: The people that work here were rude and don't speak English. You are to pay for your full trip when you check in, that should have been a warning right there. We called down to the desk our first day for extra towels and they acted like we asked for the moon. We asked for an extra blanket the next night since the air conditioner was uncontrolable. The front desk said only one blanket per room. There were 5 of us! Same goes for pillows, flat as pancakes and no extras. But our maid was nice and took care of us. No fitted sheet, just flat ones, and you woke up on the matress ! Yuk ! My husband said I was being a bed hog, but whenever he got in bed I got sucked in the middle. The balcony was only big enough for 2 people. Not fun when you have 3 teenage girls with you. Had to pay for ice, and they had only one ice machine. and ONE elevator. Talk about slow, our girls took the stairs. No hot water tile falling off, and toilet was over flowing, good thing they left the plunger next to it !!! I think this was the first vacation where I wanted to go home !! Not to sound snooty but if you like the little extras, this hotel isn't for you. We love Ocean City, and still had a wonderful time. But next year we are staying in a condo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Spend Your Birthday!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Tidelands Caribbean Hotel celebrating my birthday. Found the staff to be GREAT and the rooms (suite overlooking the pool) to be more than adequately appointed and very, very comfortable. Loved the fact that there was a pool bar that also served lite fare.

Reviews.Title: “Staff, Location, Rooms ...great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tidelands On a rainy weekend in March. It was a spur of the moment trip & we Arrived in Ocean city without plans or reservations. We chose the hotel simply because it was the first hotel we came to that we liked the look of. Our room was a two room suite on the 5th floor. The room was nice (ceramic tile floors, jacuzzi tub big enough for two). But what made the trip was staff. When we arrived it was really a pretty miserable night, which was followed by dreary morning. When asked the desk guy basically gave us the whole Julie McCoy rundown on what to do, where to go & what to eat. No mean feat considering that at that time of year, places are open or closed at the owners whim. Anyway when we got home we checked it out on the net and had trouble accepting some of the bad reviews about the place, So i wrote this as a counterpoint.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel consist of two different buildings, If you are planning on staying in the old building that offers Ocean front, you might want to stay somewhere else. The hotel is in need of some scerious updating. The ocean front room we stayed in was in need up repairs, the walls had stains, the bathroom toliet was always running, and we had to keep fixing the chain on the toliet so you could flush. The shower walls were missing tiles, and by the time you were done showing you were standing in above ankle water. They don't always replace soap, shampoo, toliet paper and I wonder how good they are at changing sheets. And from guests we talk to their rooms were along the same lines. I know you are thinking if it was so bad why did we continue to stay. Well it was Sunfest weekend and every hotel was sold out, we didn't have options. We stayed 3 nights in this room then when the weekend came we had to move to another room for 3 more nights in the other building. Which granted was a million times nicer but still not up to par. I complained to the manager that we wanted to leave and I wanted refunded for the unused nights, but they flattley refused, they would not give me a refund. He said he would personaly make sure the new room we were moving into was cleaned and spotless. Well there cleaning staff stinks, they no extras. For example we found a pair of dirty underware left in one of the dresser drawers. Some cleaning they do. I highly recommend staying away, especially during the spring to fall season when the hotels employees foreigners for the summer that can barely speak english. To say the least the customer service was extremley lacking and they had no compassion for my complaints. I will never stay there again, I rate this hotel at 1 1/2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “An okay hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I give this hotel a slighly above average rating overall. We (2 adults and 2 children) stayed in one of their suites on August 4 thru August 11. The room was clean and comfortable with a ceramic tiled floor. However, it was relatively small when compared to other suites I've stayed in. It had a small kitchenette in a short hallway separating the two bedrooms. The kitchenette consisted of a small refrigerator (without a freezer) and two-element range next to a sink. On the countertop around the sink was a coffee maker and toaster. There was also a small microwave oven. The kitchenette was cramped and not particularly useful for cooking a dinner, but was okay for making breakfast in the morning. The two bedrooms each had a king-sized bed. The larger bedroom also had a queen-sized sleep sofa. The balcony was attached to the larger bedroom. Ours overlooked the busy street below, and was not good for sitting out in the evening.
